Exterior_Patron_006_9.speaker: Manip Leythim
Exterior_Patron_006_9.text: Hey, mate, you look pretty well geared up. Can you spare a healing potion?

Exterior_Patron_006_19.speaker: Player
Exterior_Patron_006_19.text: You don't look wounded to me.

Exterior_Patron_006_8.speaker: Manip Leythim
Exterior_Patron_006_8.text: No, but I expect to be, once Hurlbut Hhune's thugs catch up with me.

Exterior_Patron_006_21.speaker: Player
Exterior_Patron_006_21.text: Hurlbut Hhune must be rich if they can afford to hire thugs to attack a Flaming Fist.

Exterior_Patron_006_17.speaker: Player
Exterior_Patron_006_17.text: The Hhune family? They're rich patriars from the Upper City, aren't they?

Exterior_Patron_006_22.speaker: Manip Leythim
Exterior_Patron_006_22.text: So rich they piss in golden pots, or at least that's what Henrietta tells me. She's Hurlbut's daughter.

Exterior_Patron_006_7.speaker: Player
Exterior_Patron_006_7.text: Who would send thugs to beat up a Flaming Fist?

Exterior_Patron_006_4.speaker: Manip Leythim
Exterior_Patron_006_4.text: How about an angry patriar who broke off his daughter Henrietta's engagement with yours truly?

Exterior_Patron_006_27.speaker: Manip Leythim
Exterior_Patron_006_27.text: We was engaged - secretly - but now it seems she's set to marry Derque Rillyn. I tried to see Hen, but papa had other ideas.

Exterior_Patron_006_1.speaker: Player
Exterior_Patron_006_1.text: And now you're preparing to be thrashed for love.

Exterior_Patron_006_12.speaker: Manip Leythim
Exterior_Patron_006_12.text: If I kick up a fuss, it might blow back on Hen. She's got troubles enough - Derque Rillyn is a major arsehole.

Exterior_Patron_006_0.speaker: Manip Leythim
Exterior_Patron_006_0.text: I guess you've never been in love.

Exterior_Patron_006_16.speaker: Player
Exterior_Patron_006_16.text: Or maybe I have. Here, take this healing potion.

Exterior_Patron_006_23.speaker: Manip Leythim
Exterior_Patron_006_23.text: Ah, my favourite flavour, too. Thanks, mate! Don't fall for any patriars' daughters!

Exterior_Patron_006_31.speaker: Player
Exterior_Patron_006_31.text: You've given me a new perspective on law enforcement in Baldur's Gate. Good luck.

Exterior_Patron_006_13.speaker: Player
Exterior_Patron_006_13.text: I'd give you a healing potion if I had one, but I'm fresh out.

Exterior_Patron_006_11.speaker: Manip Leythim
Exterior_Patron_006_11.text: Thanks for nothing, mate. At least you're polite.

Exterior_Patron_006_5.speaker: Player
Exterior_Patron_006_5.text: Why don't you get some of the other Fists to back you up against the thugs?

Exterior_Patron_006_14.speaker: Manip Leythim
Exterior_Patron_006_14.text: Have you got bugs in your head? The Fists don't mess with wealthy patriars, they've got the Watch to back them up.

Exterior_Patron_006_2.speaker: Manip Leythim
Exterior_Patron_006_2.text: And nowadays the Watch comes in a Steel variety, in case you haven't noticed. I'll take my lumps.

Exterior_Patron_006_24.speaker: Player
Exterior_Patron_006_24.text: I'm deeply moved by your plight, Manip. Accept this healing potion, and the best of luck to you.

Exterior_Patron_006_10.speaker: Player
Exterior_Patron_006_10.text: You're a Flaming Fist officer. Can't you get one from your quartermaster?

Exterior_Patron_006_18.speaker: Manip Leythim
Exterior_Patron_006_18.text: My problem isn't exactly official business. I expect to get beaten up by some thugs hired by Hurlbut Hhune.

Exterior_Patron_006_28.speaker: Manip Leythim
Exterior_Patron_006_28.text: Hello again. Still got me head on me shoulders!

Patron005_0.speaker: Grainne Jodhpur
Patron005_0.text: Yeah, I'll take the metal cops over the flesh-and-blood brutes any day of the month.
Patron005_0.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the Absolute

Patron005_1.speaker: Grainne Jodhpur
Patron005_1.text: If it were up to me, I'd replace all the Flaming Fists with Steel Watchers. At least the big teapots don't make lewd suggestions when you pass by. They smell better, too.
Patron005_1.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the Absolute

FlamingFist_002_0.speaker: Fist Aguta
FlamingFist_002_0.text: Still here, troublemaker? I told you to leave.

FlamingFist_002_1.speaker: Fist Aguta
FlamingFist_002_1.text: I just lost my patrol partner, and I've got no patience for talk. Get out of here.

AD_Devella_Fountainhead_Turn1_0.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
AD_Devella_Fountainhead_Turn1_0.text: I'll not let another killer roam this city. To arms!

Githyanki_InquisitorAD_2.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorAD_2.text: Sooner or later, even the hunted return to their den.

Githyanki_InquisitorAD_0.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorAD_0.text: In the meantime, tear every brick out if you have to. If it doesn't come, we must find evidence of its whereabouts.

AD_Falten_0.speaker: Waiter Falten
AD_Falten_0.text: Another spill. And to think I used to like the smell of ale.

AD_Falten_1.speaker: Waiter Falten
AD_Falten_1.text: Janitor in a tavern. If mother was still alive, the shame would kill her.

AD_Falten_2.speaker: Waiter Falten
AD_Falten_2.text: Murder sounds better every day. If I wasn't such a coward, I'd join a cult of Bhaal.

Githyanki_JaheiraPAD_0.speaker: Jaheira
Githyanki_JaheiraPAD_0.text: The Knights of the Shield. How many days did I search in vain for their lair, only to cap the night with a drink above it?

Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_10.speaker: Stug Minedale
Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_10.text: Still here, stranger? Me too. Not yet ready to face up to what I have to do, I guess.

Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_18.speaker: Gherva Minedale
Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_18.text: Just one more, Stug, and then we'll go. See you, stranger.

Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_19.speaker: Stug Minedale
Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_19.text: You talk about the honour of your order, but what about my honour? I made a deal!

Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_4.speaker: Gherva Minedale
Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_4.text: Stug, if you want to join the Vigilant Knights, you have to quit beating people up!

Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_12.speaker: Player
Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_12.text: Settle down, you two! People are trying to drink here. What's this about?

Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_17.speaker: Stug Minedale
Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_17.text: My sister Gherva has talked me into joining her holy Helm order, but I got a job to finish first.

Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_16.speaker: Gherva Minedale
Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_16.text: Breaking the knees of debtors for the Guild isn't honest work, and you know it - that's why you're giving it up.

Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_20.speaker: Player
Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_20.text: Does someone need to get beaten up? I can handle that.

Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_14.speaker: Stug Minedale
Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_14.text: I'm supposed to bust up this guy what owes money to Uktar of the Guild, but Gherva says if I want to join her order that's a no-go.

Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_0.speaker: Stug Minedale
Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_0.text: But I already took the money for it from Uktar, so I got to follow through - it's like an oath or something.

Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_8.speaker: Stug Minedale
Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_8.text: And I know you understand oaths, Gherva.

Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_2.speaker: Gherva Minedale
Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_2.text: What am I going to tell the Vigilant Knights, Stug? That you're knee-breaking for goodness?

Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_15.speaker: Player
Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_15.text: If he wants to join an order of Helm, it sounds to me Stug has to give up knee-breaking, effective immediately.

Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_5.speaker: Gherva Minedale
Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_5.text: You know that's right, Stug. If Uktar sends someone after you, I'll back you up - and so will the rest of the knights.

Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_6.speaker: Stug Minedale
Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_6.text: You say that now, but you haven't met Uktar's enforcer Elliott.

Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_11.speaker: Stug Minedale
Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_11.text: No, you're right. I'm sick of the whole business. If Elliott comes looking for me, we'll find a way to deal with him.

Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_9.speaker: Player
Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_9.text: If Stug's already been paid for the task, he has to follow through on it.

Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_1.speaker: Stug Minedale
Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_1.text: See? Look, Gherva, I'll only break his left knee. You can come along and make sure I don't overdo it. For Helm, you know?

Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_7.speaker: Gherva Minedale
Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_7.text: Moradin's stones! I hate this a lot, but you're my only brother, after all. Very well, let's get this over with.

Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_3.speaker: Player
Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_3.text: Tell you what, Stug - give me the money Uktar paid you for the job, and then you're off the hook.

Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_22.speaker: Stug Minedale
Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_22.text: Helm's gaze, you sound like a Guild lawyer! You must think I'm pretty dumb. And maybe I am, because I'm going back to return Uktar's money.

Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_21.speaker: Stug Minedale
Exterior_Patron_000_And_Patron_002_21.text: Don't wait up, Gherva - it might take me a while to crawl back home with two busted knees.

ComedyTournament_Watcher001_0.speaker: Phibs Brogan
ComedyTournament_Watcher001_0.text: Get ready! I hear this guy is really good. My buddy Roanoke almost pissed himself laughing.

ComedyTournament_Watcher001_3.speaker: Narrator
ComedyTournament_Watcher001_3.text: *This dwarf in the audience matches the description of that serial killer. He bears watching.*

ComedyTournament_Watcher001_5.speaker: Phibs Brogan
ComedyTournament_Watcher001_5.text: What in the hells are you staring at? Have I got spinach in my teeth?

ComedyTournament_Watcher001_2.speaker: Player
ComedyTournament_Watcher001_2.text: Your name isn't Dolor, is it?

ComedyTournament_Watcher001_12.speaker: Phibs Brogan
ComedyTournament_Watcher001_12.text: No, and it isn't Sucker or Patsy, either. Whatever your con is, try it on someone else.

ComedyTournament_Watcher001_6.speaker: Player
ComedyTournament_Watcher001_6.text: No, no. Nice doublet, that's all. Red. It's nice.

ComedyTournament_Watcher001_9.speaker: Phibs Brogan
ComedyTournament_Watcher001_9.text: Isn't it? Got it at Carmen's, if you must know. Now button it - I want to hear this guy.

ComedyTournament_Watcher001_1.speaker: Phibs Brogan
ComedyTournament_Watcher001_1.text: This guy's funny! I like his monocle. Anyone who wears a monocle is all right with me. In fact, I should get a monocle.

ComedyTournament_Watcher001_8.speaker: Phibs Brogan
ComedyTournament_Watcher001_8.text: Ha ha hah! This guy is funnier than a gnome on a windmill!

ComedyTournament_Watcher001_11.speaker: Phibs Brogan
ComedyTournament_Watcher001_11.text: This guy was funnier the other night. Of course, I'd had more to drink then.

AD_Yimuir_0.speaker: Waiter Yimuir
AD_Yimuir_0.text: Oh? You try to get fresh tomatoes in a city under siege.

AD_Yimuir_1.speaker: Waiter Yimuir
AD_Yimuir_1.text: I know you said porter, but we only have ale.

AD_Yimuir_2.speaker: Waiter Yimuir
AD_Yimuir_2.text: Are those pickled trotters ready yet?

AD_Yimuir_3.speaker: Waiter Yimuir
AD_Yimuir_3.text: Table fourteen wants their eggs, now!

AD_Devella_Fountainhead_PrivateRoom_1.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
AD_Devella_Fountainhead_PrivateRoom_1.text: To take the hand is strange. To take nothing else is even stranger.

AD_Devella_Fountainhead_PrivateRoom_2.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
AD_Devella_Fountainhead_PrivateRoom_2.text: There's something missing, but... I can't grasp it. Shite.

AD_Devella_Fountainhead_PrivateRoom_3.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
AD_Devella_Fountainhead_PrivateRoom_3.text: A ritual killing, maybe? But that's not how those Absolutists operate...

Reevor_0.speaker: Chef Roveer
Reevor_0.text: Chef Roveer still hears squeaking. Why do you not kill rats? Rats too tough?

Reevor_47.speaker: Player
Reevor_47.text: Actually, I'm here to warn you. You're on this list of murder targets - you need to hide.

Reevor_8.speaker: Chef Roveer
Reevor_8.text: Chef Roveer has been staying most vigilant since your warning, yes. Only murders in this kitchen will be of the rat-kind.

Reevor_10.speaker: Chef Roveer
Reevor_10.text: Ey! We got rats in t'cellar. We also got cats, but cats are useless, so how about you kill the rats?

Reevor_30.speaker: Player
Reevor_30.text: I was just down there. Those rats are the size of ponies.

Reevor_49.speaker: Chef Roveer
Reevor_49.text: What! Giant rats! No, I do not believe it, giant rats is silly.

Reevor_36.speaker: Player
Reevor_36.text: You need to forget killing rats - someone's out to kill you. You're on a murder target list.

Reevor_46.speaker: Player
Reevor_46.text: Good news, chef! I already killed the rats.

Reevor_9.speaker: Chef Roveer
Reevor_9.text: You did? Very clever. Good job, yes. Here, you take this.

Reevor_48.speaker: Player
Reevor_48.text: Just kidding! The rats are dead, but you can keep your paltry reward.

Reevor_27.speaker: Chef Roveer
Reevor_27.text: Insult Chef Roveer's reward if you want, but someday you will look back and say, 'Killing rats - that was a mighty task!'

Reevor_40.speaker: Chef Roveer
Reevor_40.text: And do not worry - Chef Roveer's eyes will be kept most peeled for murderous knaves.

Reevor_19.speaker: Chef Roveer
Reevor_19.text: Ey, you already got paid, no more work here. Plenty o' rats elsewhere in the city, go kill those.

Reevor_22.speaker: Player
Reevor_22.text: I need to warn you, chef - your name is on a murderer's target list.

Reevor_37.speaker: Chef Roveer
Reevor_37.text: Rats, murderers... Always knew the chef gig wasn't going to be easy.

Reevor_12.speaker: Chef Roveer
Reevor_12.text: Do not worry - Chef Roveer's eyes will be kept peeled for murdering types.

Reevor_26.speaker: Chef Roveer
Reevor_26.text: I thought I asked you to clean the rats out of this cellar yesterday, already. Hop to it! Get in there!

Reevor_4.speaker: Player
Reevor_4.text: The rats are unimportant - your name is on a list of murder targets. You need to hide.

Reevor_32.speaker: Chef Roveer
Reevor_32.text: No, I need them rats taking care of!

Reevor_53.speaker: Chef Roveer
Reevor_53.text: Here's the deal - I'll keep a look out for murderers, you murder the rats.

Reevor_7.speaker: Chef Roveer
Reevor_7.text: True adventuring soul, you are. No battle too small!

Reevor_52.speaker: Player
Reevor_52.text: Why don't you simply speak to them?

Reevor_5.speaker: Chef Roveer
Reevor_5.text: Speak? To the filthy vermin who are ruining my stock? I think not.
Reevor_5.context: NodeContext: more put out as opposed to outraged

Reevor_35.speaker: Player
Reevor_35.text: I'm an adventurer, not an exterminator.

Reevor_23.speaker: Chef Roveer
Reevor_23.text: Adventurers have to get their start somehow. Ye haven't got the spirit of a hero in ye if you think you're above killing a few rats.

Reevor_31.speaker: Chef Roveer
Reevor_31.text: Probably. Lot of rats in this world. Been having problems with 'em in cellars for the whole twenty years of my career.

Reevor_15.speaker: Player
Reevor_15.text: You dare ask this of me, the literal child of Bhaal, god of murder?

Reevor_1.speaker: Chef Roveer
Reevor_1.text: Killing's killing, don't say you love your work if you ain't sticking by it. Real Bhaalspawn would kill them rats.

Reevor_42.speaker: Chef Roveer
Reevor_42.text: Oh, go on. Nothing better to practise your skills on than a few rats.

Reevor_33.speaker: Player
Reevor_33.text: I would never kill an innocent animal!

Reevor_29.speaker: Chef Roveer
Reevor_29.text: They're not animals. They're vermin. They're a source of diseases and infections and they're ruining my stock!

Reevor_14.speaker: Player
Reevor_14.text: I don't eat rats. Rude dwarves, on the other hand...

Reevor_13.speaker: Chef Roveer
Reevor_13.text: Eh, I - uh, I mean if you could get to the rats, that'd be great. Nothing better to practise your skills on than a few rats.
Reevor_13.context: NodeContext: nervous, trying to be jovial at the end

Reevor_41.speaker: Chef Roveer
Reevor_41.text: Really? I could've sworn you were an adventurer. You look like an adventurer. And you talk like an adventurer. So you must be an adventurer!

Reevor_43.speaker: Chef Roveer
Reevor_43.text: I can see in your eyes - you want to warn me of killers again. No! The only murder I want to hear of is rat murder. Begone!

Reevor_45.speaker: Chef Roveer
Reevor_45.text: You kill the rats, yes? I heard commotion in the cellar. Good, perfect - here, you take this.

Exterior_Waiter_2.speaker: Player
Exterior_Waiter_2.text: Ho, server! What's the best thing on your drinks menu?

Exterior_Waiter_1.speaker: Waiter Thorne
Exterior_Waiter_1.text: Sorry, valued client, you're asking the wrong person- I don't serve drinks, I just clean up the spills and empty glasses. Talk to Alan inside.

Exterior_Waiter_0.speaker: Player
Exterior_Waiter_0.text: What's that song you're sort-of singing?

Exterior_Waiter_7.speaker: Waiter Thorne
Exterior_Waiter_7.text: 'The Roses of Eleint'. I may work for a hard-hearted ratfucker, but I still keep a song in my heart.

Exterior_Waiter_6.speaker: Player
Exterior_Waiter_6.text: Have you ever thought about becoming a bard? Because if you have, you shouldn't.

Exterior_Waiter_4.speaker: Waiter Thorne
Exterior_Waiter_4.text: Very funny. If that joke wasn't older than I am, I'd laugh.

Exterior_Waiter_5.speaker: Waiter Thorne
Exterior_Waiter_5.text: Still here, valued client? The drinks are still inside.

PAD_RingWithBlood_3.speaker: Player
PAD_RingWithBlood_3.text: Bloodied ring... Guess the killer didn't want jewellery.

PAD_RingWithBlood_0.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PAD_RingWithBlood_0.text: Leave that alone! This is a crime scene, not an antiques auction.

PAD_RingWithBlood_1.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PAD_RingWithBlood_1.text: Seems they were after the hand. Which is... troubling, to say the least.

Patron004_0.speaker: Thimble
Patron004_0.text: Remember when we could just go down to the tavern and enjoy a few hands of cards? Now, all we do is worry.
Patron004_0.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the Absolute

Patron004_1.speaker: Thimble
Patron004_1.text: As far as I'm concerned, Lord Gortash gets the benefit of the doubt. Until he does something obviously wrong, he's got my support. We can't afford to be squabbling with the Absolute crawling up our arses.
Patron004_1.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the Absolute

Exterior_Patron_007_0.speaker: Saer Frenello
Exterior_Patron_007_0.text: Tyr's balls... Just lost the best job I ever had, easy work in the Upper City - but you don't care, and why should you? Sorry I said anything.

Exterior_Patron_007_1.speaker: Saer Frenello
Exterior_Patron_007_1.text: You haven't heard of any open positions for an event planner, have you? No, of course not - just look at you. Why do I even bother?

Taproom_AD_FlamingFists_1.speaker: Fist Rusk
Taproom_AD_FlamingFists_1.text: Hold up, citizen! This is a crime scene - no admittance.

Taproom_AD_FlamingFists_0.speaker: Fist Aguta
Taproom_AD_FlamingFists_0.text: Devella's finished her report. You can let them pass.

Alfira_2.speaker: Alfira
Alfira_2.text: You and I are going to take this city by storm - I know it.

Alfira_33.speaker: Alfira
Alfira_33.text: I could stay up here all day - the view is something else, isn't it?
Alfira_33.context: NodeContext: lost, a little sad looking

Alfira_36.speaker: Alfira
Alfira_36.text: It's you! Look at us - we made it to the city! We made it to the Elfsong Tavern.
Alfira_36.context: NodeContext: delighted, over the moon to see the player.

Alfira_22.speaker: Player
Alfira_22.text: I'm glad to see you safe, Alfira.

Alfira_8.speaker: Alfira
Alfira_8.text: And I you. Never thought I'd live to perform for the greatest audience in the Realms - the entirety of Baldur's Gate.
Alfira_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Geastures behind her.NodeContext: Geastures behind her to the view of the city. Affectionate, cares for the player and is happy to see them.

Alfira_29.speaker: Player
Alfira_29.text: We're technically on top of the Elfsong Tavern.

Alfira_45.speaker: Alfira
Alfira_45.text: I mean, what better audience could a bard ask for than the entirety of Baldur's Gate?
Alfira_45.context: CinematicNodeContext: Geastures behind her.NodeContext: Geastures behind her. Big smile, cheerful

Alfira_43.speaker: Player
Alfira_43.text: Why are you hiding away up here?

Alfira_0.speaker: Alfira
Alfira_0.text: Not hiding, silly - performing. And what better audience is there than the entirety of Baldur's Gate?
Alfira_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Geastures behind her.NodeContext: Geastures behind her. Big smile, affectionate, happy to be here and to be alive

Alfira_13.speaker: Alfira
Alfira_13.text: Lakrissa lets me practice up here when she's on shift downstairs. She's too good to me.
Alfira_13.context: NodeContext: shy smile (her and lakrissa are a thing).

Alfira_46.speaker: Alfira
Alfira_46.text: But you - I have a bone to pick with you, oh brave adventurer.
Alfira_46.context: NodeContext: teasing, pretending to be serious, maybe hands on hips or a wagging finger.

Alfira_12.speaker: Player
Alfira_12.text: Oh dear, am I in trouble?

Alfira_3.speaker: Alfira
Alfira_3.text: BIG trouble. The most trouble you've ever been in.
Alfira_3.context: NodeContext: teasing, pretending to be serious, maybe hands on hips

Alfira_35.speaker: Alfira
Alfira_35.text: I've decided I'm not going to perform in the Elfsong - mainly because only the Elfsong itself is allowed to perform.
Alfira_35.context: NodeContext: second line as an aside, maybe said a bit quieter (the ghost of the elfsong itself is the only thing allowed to perform in the elfsong)

Alfira_48.speaker: Alfira
Alfira_48.text: I'm going to open up a school of bards - the best in the Realms! To usher in a new age of magic and musicianship.
Alfira_48.context: NodeContext: excited, this is the happiest and most confident we've ever seen her

Alfira_17.speaker: Alfira
Alfira_17.text: And it's because of you that I dared dream big enough.
Alfira_17.context: NodeContext: teasing drops, sincere, emotive, grateful

Alfira_15.speaker: Player
Alfira_15.text: That's wonderful, Alfira. I'm proud of you.

Alfira_25.speaker: Alfira
Alfira_25.text: Thank you - that means a lot. I wanted to tell you first because, well, you inspired me to do it.

Alfira_20.speaker: Alfira
Alfira_20.text: Here - my very first lute, tuned to perfection. Thought you'd appreciate it when I'm rich and famous.
Alfira_20.context: NodeContext: generic handing motion. Emotive, trying to act light and teasing at end, but this is a big deal for her to hand this over - it's one of the most important things in the world to her.

Alfira_7.speaker: Alfira
Alfira_7.text: I had something for you, my very first lute, but I seem to have fallen prey to the city's sticky fingers. Kindly imagine I've given it to you, yeah?
Alfira_7.context: NodeContext: little sad but also knows it's not the end of the world. Cheeky and fun at the end.

Alfira_42.speaker: Alfira
Alfira_42.text: Take care, my friend. Thank you for helping a stumbling bard in a druids' grove find her spark again.

Alfira_37.speaker: Alfira
Alfira_37.text: Take care, my friend. Thank you for helping a bunch of ragtag tieflings in a druids' grove find their way home.

Alfira_41.speaker: Player
Alfira_41.text: Well - I think you should name your school after me, don't you?

Alfira_24.speaker: Alfira
Alfira_24.text: You and Lihala's names in bold? Hm - I like it. Deal.

Alfira_44.speaker: Alfira
Alfira_44.text: Oh, hush - I know you love me really.

Alfira_23.speaker: Player
Alfira_23.text: I'm going to send all my students to you, obviously.

Alfira_28.speaker: Alfira
Alfira_28.text: You're going to make me cry, damn you.

Alfira_9.speaker: Player
Alfira_9.text: Good to know where I should avoid.

Alfira_27.speaker: Alfira
Alfira_27.text: Har, har - not all of us can be big-time adventuring bards.
Alfira_27.context: NodeContext: rolling her eyes with a smile

Alfira_21.speaker: Player
Alfira_21.text: Alfira, I could crush you one hand.

Alfira_6.speaker: Alfira
Alfira_6.context: NodeContext: wave of her hand, smile

Alfira_14.speaker: Player
Alfira_14.text: Is this because I broke your lute that one time?

Alfira_19.speaker: Alfira
Alfira_19.text: I've forgiven you for that - just about. But no - that's not why.

Alfira_32.speaker: Alfira
Alfira_32.text: Your grumpy face may scare the others, but I'm afraid I'm made of sterner stuff.

Alfira_4.speaker: Player
Alfira_4.text: I'm shocked you haven't been arrested for making all that noise.

Alfira_30.speaker: Alfira
Alfira_30.text: How dare - the clouds have been most appreciative of my performance.
Alfira_30.context: NodeContext: acting shocking, teasing, having fun with player

Alfira_47.speaker: Alfira
Alfira_47.text: Ah - you startled me. I was lost in my own world.
Alfira_47.context: NodeContext: sad smile, holding her arms - looking away

Alfira_10.speaker: Player
Alfira_10.text: What are you doing up here?

Alfira_34.speaker: Alfira
Alfira_34.text: Thinking about my old teacher - Lihala. She would have been so proud to see me here, but what's the point?

Alfira_38.speaker: Alfira
Alfira_38.text: I'm not a bard - not anymore. I thought coming here would help me figure out my life, but I just feel more lost.

Alfira_31.speaker: Player
Alfira_31.text: You seem a bit down - everything all right?

Alfira_39.speaker: Alfira
Alfira_39.text: Not really. My teacher would have been so proud to see me here. But what's the point?

Alfira_11.speaker: Player
Alfira_11.text: Stay alert - this city is full of enemies.

Alfira_40.speaker: Alfira
Alfira_40.text: I know - it never stops, does it?

Alfira_18.speaker: Alfira
Alfira_18.text: I thought coming to the city would help me figure out my life - what I wanted to do without music. But I just feel more lost.

Alfira_5.speaker: Alfira
Alfira_5.text: Sorry - I'm only alive because of you, and I am grateful. I just... need some time.

EmperorAD_EmperorEmptyJars_0.text: An old container for brains. Empty - shame. It would have been nice to find one to sustain me now.

PAD_BedWithBood_0.speaker: Player
PAD_BedWithBood_0.text: Lots of blood... Some pink stains, too.

PAD_BedWithBood_2.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PAD_BedWithBood_2.text: Blood? At a crime scene? What a startling discovery.

PAD_BedWithBood_1.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PAD_BedWithBood_1.text: Lots of blood, yes, but doesn't look like she fought her killer. Strange.

EmperorAD_Sewers_0.text: My old home - we're close by. It would be good to see it again. Look for a ladder up.

EmperorAD_EmperorBeforeCellar_0.text: The cellars are just down the stairs - there you'll find my old lodgings.

EmperorAD_ButterFork_0.text: My cutlery set - a gift from my mother. The butter knife is missing, but otherwise it looks to be complete. I don't need it anymore, but the memory stirs something in me still.

Patron_007_2.speaker: Clovia Throaks
Patron_007_2.text: I thought you were going for a walk, Blars?

Patron_007_28.speaker: Blarson Throaks
Patron_007_28.text: What? Oh. You're still here. Maybe you should take the walk.

Patron_007_7.speaker: Clovia Throaks
Patron_007_7.text: Drink up, Blars, we're celebrating! If you won't drink with me, I bet this stranger will. Right, stranger?

Patron_007_17.speaker: Player
Patron_007_17.text: What are you celebrating? Maybe I will.

Patron_007_11.speaker: Blarson Throaks
Patron_007_11.text: It's Clo's favourite, plum prosecco. I'd rather drink almost anything else, frankly.

Patron_007_0.speaker: Clovia Throaks
Patron_007_0.text: I'm Clovia Throaks, pleased to meet you! Our son Gasper has finally found himself a proper job.

Patron_007_30.speaker: Blarson Throaks
Patron_007_30.text: Aye, security at the Steel Watch Foundry. But I still wish he'd taken up the family business.

Patron_007_32.speaker: Clovia Throaks
Patron_007_32.text: Now, Blars, you know Gasper never had the patience for all the stitching a tailor has to do.

Patron_007_27.speaker: Player
Patron_007_27.text: A tailor? That's good, honest work.

Patron_007_10.speaker: Clovia Throaks
Patron_007_10.text: Sewing rabbit-skin cloaks? That's all right for some, I guess, but not for our Gasper.

Patron_007_1.speaker: Blarson Throaks
Patron_007_1.text: No, our Gasper preferred hanging around the Guildhall. I was afraid he was going to end up as a Guild bone-breaker.

Patron_007_4.speaker: Clovia Throaks
Patron_007_4.text: Good thing I introduced him to darling Tamia Holzt. She straightened Gasper out, found him a place in the Foundry.

Patron_007_14.speaker: Player
Patron_007_14.text: Clovia, you sound like an admirer of this Tamia. Are you... close?

Patron_007_22.speaker: Clovia Throaks
Patron_007_22.text: Blars, the plum bubbles may have gone to my head, but I guess it's time to tell you.

Patron_007_31.speaker: Clovia Throaks
Patron_007_31.text: I'm leaving you. I'm starting a new life with Tamia.

Patron_007_23.speaker: Clovia Throaks
Patron_007_23.text: I'm going to sell the business. The money we used to start it was mine in the first place. I'm afraid that's it for 'Throaks for Cloaks'.

Patron_007_33.speaker: Clovia Throaks
Patron_007_33.text: Oh, dear, the bottle's empty. Let's have another and talk about it.

Patron_007_21.speaker: Blarson Throaks
Patron_007_21.text: I... I think I need to take a walk. In a minute.

Patron_007_26.speaker: Player
Patron_007_26.text: Blars, right? Are you serious about getting Gasper to join your business?

Patron_007_16.speaker: Blarson Throaks
Patron_007_16.text: Serious? I'd promote him from rat-catcher! Full partner!

Patron_007_13.speaker: Player
Patron_007_13.text: You married a tailor? Is that the best you could do?

Patron_007_8.speaker: Blarson Throaks
Patron_007_8.text: Here, you can't talk to Clo that way, you... you vagabond! Take that back, or else!

Patron_007_12.speaker: Player
Patron_007_12.text: I beg your pardon. I meant no insult to your lady.

Patron_007_6.speaker: Clovia Throaks
Patron_007_6.text: Oh, Blars! I never knew you had it in you! Let's get another bottle - and take it home!

Patron_007_9.speaker: Player
Patron_007_9.text: You want a fight? You're on. Let's step out back.

Patron_007_3.speaker: Blarson Throaks
Patron_007_3.text: Fight? With you? Um, no. Come on, Clo. Let's head home.

Patron_007_24.speaker: Clovia Throaks
Patron_007_24.text: No, Blars. I've been trying to tell you something all night.

Patron_007_20.speaker: Player
Patron_007_20.text: You're celebrating when the city's in crisis?

Patron_007_19.speaker: Clovia Throaks
Patron_007_19.text: Life must go on, eh? I may have an adult son, but I'm not ready to jump in the coffin yet.

Patron_007_18.speaker: Clovia Throaks
Patron_007_18.text: And he's finally made good! The lad has found himself a proper job.

GuardingFlamingFists_10.speaker: Fist Aguta
GuardingFlamingFists_10.text: The job description doesn't include 'be an arsehole', Thauniel. Relax.

GuardingFlamingFists_6.speaker: Fist Rusk
GuardingFlamingFists_6.text: Halt, civvie. Turn back. This is an active crime scene.

GuardingFlamingFists_4.speaker: Fist Aguta
GuardingFlamingFists_4.text: Hold on, Thauniel. I'm tired of standing here. Devella's been up there for ages. Some diversion would be welcome.

GuardingFlamingFists_9.speaker: Player
GuardingFlamingFists_9.text: Investigator Valeria told me to speak with Constable Devella.

GuardingFlamingFists_5.speaker: Fist Rusk
GuardingFlamingFists_5.text: Constable Devella said she wasn't to be -

GuardingFlamingFists_7.speaker: Fist Aguta
GuardingFlamingFists_7.text: Investigator Valeria outranks her. As you were, civvie. Fair warning, though - she's in a foul mood.

GuardingFlamingFists_8.speaker: Player
GuardingFlamingFists_8.text: Maybe I can be of help.

GuardingFlamingFists_0.speaker: Fist Rusk
GuardingFlamingFists_0.text: We are not at liberty to discuss an active -

GuardingFlamingFists_3.speaker: Fist Aguta
GuardingFlamingFists_3.text: Everybody knows Duke Stelmane was murdered here, Thauniel.

GuardingFlamingFists_1.speaker: Fist Aguta
GuardingFlamingFists_1.text: Chances are the constable will throw you down the stairs, but go ahead, citizen. I could do with something to break the monotony.

Patron_011_0.speaker: Caitriono
Patron_011_0.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the Absolute

Patron_011_1.speaker: Caitriono
Patron_011_1.text: I pity whoever it was rented out the upper floor. Know why? Rats. Place is full of 'em.
Patron_011_1.context: InternalNodeContext: The players paid for exclusive use of Elfsong Tavern first floor.

Patron_011_2.speaker: Caitriono
Patron_011_2.text: I liked the city better when it was gloomy, before Umberlee banished the fogs. Sunlight just makes my eyes water. Luckily, it's still gloomy in here.
Patron_011_2.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the Absolute

Patron_011_3.speaker: Caitriono
Patron_011_3.text: Gortash, an Archduke? Saw him once, at a distance - looked like too much of a pipsqueak to fill those boots.
Patron_011_3.context: InternalNodeContext: Coronation of Gortash as lord of Baldur's Gate.

Patron_011_4.speaker: Caitriono
Patron_011_4.text: If Lorroakan was so smart, he'd have stuck with pulling rabbits out of hats. Instead, he had to try sawing a celestial in half. Haw!
Patron_011_4.context: InternalNodeContext: Lorroakan has been deposed from Ramazith's Tower + no longer owns Sorcerous Sundries

Patron_011_5.speaker: Caitriono
Patron_011_5.text: They say Lord Gortash is dead. It's probably true - aim high, fall hard.

Patron_011_6.speaker: Caitriono
Patron_011_6.text: I wonder if this Rolan feller is buying magic rings? And if so, where can I get one?
Patron_011_6.context: InternalNodeContext: Rolan as new owner of Sorcerous Sundries

Patron_011_7.speaker: Caitriono
Patron_011_7.text: Fame turned to ashes in your mouth yet?
Patron_011_7.context: InternalNodeContext: Reputation booster because an article at Baldur's Mouth

Patron_011_8.speaker: Caitriono
Patron_011_8.text: So the Sundries has new management! I tried to sell a magic ring I found in an alley to Lorroakan, once, and the hell boar threw me out.
Patron_011_8.context: InternalNodeContext: Rolan as new owner of Sorcerous Sundries

Patron_011_9.speaker: Caitriono
Patron_011_9.text: Big commotion out in Grey Harbour, according to the B-Mouth. I figure it's just Ol' Cholms having indigestion.
Patron_011_9.context: InternalNodeContext: Iron Throne Destruction (ie. vague trouble in harbour)

Patron_011_10.speaker: Caitriono
Patron_011_10.text: There's so many rats in the Elfsong Tavern, I hear the cook wants to hire a rat-catcher. I'd apply, but I fear I'm over-qualified.
Patron_011_10.context: InternalNodeContext: The players paid for exclusive use of Elfsong Tavern first floor.

Patron_011_11.speaker: Caitriono
Patron_011_11.text: Well, of course the Steel Watchers have come to nothing. Gondians, always mucketing about with gears and widgets. What good has it ever done us?

Patron_011_12.speaker: Caitriono
Patron_011_12.text: And so Lorroakan meets the fate of all ambitious wizards! They're mostly frauds, you know, wizards. Abracadabra, my arse.
Patron_011_12.context: InternalNodeContext: Lorroakan has been deposed from Ramazith's Tower + no longer owns Sorcerous Sundries

Patron_011_13.speaker: Caitriono
Patron_011_13.text: Don't tell anyone I called Archduke Gortash a pipsqueak, all right? Thanks.
Patron_011_13.context: InternalNodeContext: Coronation of Gortash as lord of Baldur's Gate.

Patron_011_14.speaker: Caitriono
Patron_011_14.text: From what I read in Baldur's Mouth, I'd bet you're pretty pleased with yourself. Good luck with that. Doesn't last.
Patron_011_14.context: InternalNodeContext: Reputation booster because an article at Baldur's Mouth

Patron_011_15.speaker: Caitriono
Patron_011_15.text: You know about Ol' Cholms, right? The gigantic snapping turtle in Grey Harbour? Ah, never mind.
Patron_011_15.context: InternalNodeContext: Iron Throne Destruction (ie. vague trouble in harbour)

Patron_011_16.speaker: Caitriono
Patron_011_16.text: Now that I think about it, I wonder if any of those busted Watchers have valuable parts. Loose and removable, as it were.

Patron_011_17.speaker: Caitriono
Patron_011_17.text: If Gortash is dead, it'll mean the other dukes will be vying for power again. Plague take all of 'em.

Exterior_Patron_000_0.speaker: Stug Minedale
Exterior_Patron_000_0.text: When you owe money to Uktar the Guild bursar, it's safer to drink in the Elfsong than in the Guildhall. Right?

Exterior_Patron_000_1.speaker: Stug Minedale
Exterior_Patron_000_1.text: This better be my last drink. Can't put off settling my Guild business forever - or they'll settle it for me.

OxordWilloughby_0.speaker: Belford Willoughby
OxordWilloughby_0.text: Welcome to the Elfsong Traveller, tavern. No, wait, that's backwards. Anyway, my dad tells the jokes here, sometimes they're funny.

OxordWilloughby_1.speaker: Belford Willoughby
OxordWilloughby_1.text: Hello again, Traveller. If you know any good jokes, my dad could use a few new ones.

OxordWilloughby_2.speaker: Belford Willoughby
OxordWilloughby_2.text: My father won again. He always wins - it's super boring. Why aren't you funny, saer?

OxordWilloughby_3.speaker: Belford Willoughby
OxordWilloughby_3.text: Ha ha! For once, dad lost! Maybe he can retire some of those jokes now. ...Though I do like the one about killing the drow.

Patron003_0.speaker: Cyndirie Vand
Patron003_0.text: Just wait. You'll see that I'm right about Lord Gortash.
Patron003_0.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the Absolute

Patron003_1.speaker: Cyndirie Vand
Patron003_1.text: Just between us, I don't believe everything I hear from Director - sorry, Archduke Gortash. He's entirely too slick to be trustworthy.
Patron003_1.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the Absolute

AD_PlayingCards_2.speaker: Buff Tanner
AD_PlayingCards_2.text: The stakes are too high for me. I'm out.

AD_PlayingCards_10.speaker: Cyndirie Vand
AD_PlayingCards_10.text: The stakes were just fine when you had a hand of five winds.

AD_PlayingCards_1.speaker: Buff Tanner
AD_PlayingCards_1.text: Maybe I'm just tired of playing Talis.

AD_PlayingCards_3.speaker: Thimble
AD_PlayingCards_3.text: More likely you just think you've taken us for as much as you can.

AD_PlayingCards_4.speaker: Buff Tanner
AD_PlayingCards_4.text: Ah, lots of stones and waves this time!

AD_PlayingCards_7.speaker: Grainne Jodhpur
AD_PlayingCards_7.text: I don't believe a word you say. I'll bet your hand is half arcana.

AD_PlayingCards_9.speaker: Grainne Jodhpur
AD_PlayingCards_9.text: More than I can afford, as usual.

AD_PlayingCards_12.speaker: Grainne Jodhpur
AD_PlayingCards_12.text: Cheaters at Talis tend to go home dead, you know.

AD_PlayingCards_13.speaker: Thimble
AD_PlayingCards_13.text: Are you saying someone here is cheating?

AD_PlayingCards_5.speaker: Grainne Jodhpur
AD_PlayingCards_5.text: Just casually mentioning what happens if someone does.

AD_PlayingCards_14.speaker: Cyndirie Vand
AD_PlayingCards_14.text: I remember when playing Talis was fun.

AD_PlayingCards_6.speaker: Thimble
AD_PlayingCards_6.text: Try losing and see how you like that.

EmperorAD_EmperorPrivateRoom_0.text: Stelmane's parlour - a place to receive clients and informants. I wonder if it's as I remember it.

EmperorAD_EmperorPrisonerChains_0.text: The chains I used to bind my meals - villains and lawbreakers. You see I tried to exercise morality, where I could.

Patron002_0.speaker: Buff Tanner
Patron002_0.text: Hells, I didn't drive them refugees out of their homes, the Absolute did that. It's not my responsibility to get them new homes. We got our own people to look after.
Patron002_0.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the Absolute

Patron002_1.speaker: Buff Tanner
Patron002_1.text: I been thinking about it - I feel bad about all them refugees, but we just can't let them flood into the city. We'd be overwhelmed. In fact, that's probably the Absolute army's plan.
Patron002_1.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the Absolute

Exterior_Patron_001_8.speaker: Doora Thumbfoot
Exterior_Patron_001_8.text: Pardon me, saer. You look... prosperous.

Exterior_Patron_001_1.speaker: Doora Thumbfoot
Exterior_Patron_001_1.text: I'll bet you have someone who'd like a nice piece of jewellery. At a discount price. For... for a good cause.
Exterior_Patron_001_1.context: NodeContext: trying to smile and put on a brave face (she needs to sell this necklace to flee the city, but it's important to her)

Exterior_Patron_001_29.speaker: Doora Thumbfoot
Exterior_Patron_001_29.text: A beautiful necklace. It - it belonged to my grandmother. I'll give it you for a bit of coin. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
Exterior_Patron_001_29.context: NodeContext: trying to smile and put on a brave face (she needs to sell this necklace to flee the city, but it's important to her)

Exterior_Patron_001_22.speaker: Player
Exterior_Patron_001_22.text: Why ask me? Why not sell it to a merchant?

Exterior_Patron_001_16.speaker: Doora Thumbfoot
Exterior_Patron_001_16.text: I hate to say it, but I'm desperate. The jeweller only offered me a pittance. It seems the market is flooded with loot brought in by adventurers.

Exterior_Patron_001_0.speaker: Player
Exterior_Patron_001_0.text: A pittance is better than nothing, surely?

Exterior_Patron_001_38.speaker: Doora Thumbfoot
Exterior_Patron_001_38.text: I guess beggars can't be choosers. Thanks anyway.

Exterior_Patron_001_31.speaker: Player
Exterior_Patron_001_31.text: Keep your jewellery. Here - for your troubles. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

Exterior_Patron_001_27.speaker: Doora Thumbfoot
Exterior_Patron_001_27.text: I don't know what to say! Except thank you. Thank you so much.
Exterior_Patron_001_27.context: NodeContext: over the moon, delighted, grateful

Exterior_Patron_001_21.speaker: Player
Exterior_Patron_001_21.text: I... may have contributed to that problem. Sorry about that.

Exterior_Patron_001_39.speaker: Doora Thumbfoot
Exterior_Patron_001_39.text: Farewell, I suppose. Thank you for listening to my troubles.

Exterior_Patron_001_7.speaker: Doora Thumbfoot
Exterior_Patron_001_7.text: Thank you, saer. You've done me a kindness.
Exterior_Patron_001_7.context: InternalNodeContext: Requires checking of an object flag to ensure NPC has necklaceNodeContext: resigned, knows she needed the money

Exterior_Patron_001_4.speaker: Doora Thumbfoot
Exterior_Patron_001_4.text: Here, I'll just - wait. Where is it? No! This was our ticket out of Baldur's Gate!
Exterior_Patron_001_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: panicked, she can't find the necklaceNodeContext: Requires checking of an object flag to ensure NPC has necklace

Exterior_Patron_001_18.speaker: Doora Thumbfoot
Exterior_Patron_001_18.text: Damn it all - need to find it!
Exterior_Patron_001_18.context: CinematicNodeContext: panicked, she can't find the necklace

Exterior_Patron_001_34.speaker: Doora Thumbfoot
Exterior_Patron_001_34.text: But you don't have enough gold! You shouldn't tease like that, it's mean.

Exterior_Patron_001_40.speaker: Player
Exterior_Patron_001_40.text: I might - if you tell me what you need the money for.

Exterior_Patron_001_30.speaker: Doora Thumbfoot
Exterior_Patron_001_30.text: Escape. Escape from Baldur's Gate for my husband, and me. Lord Gortash wants Maryk's head, so we have to get out.
Exterior_Patron_001_30.context: NodeContext: a bit upset, worried, scared

Exterior_Patron_001_11.speaker: Doora Thumbfoot
Exterior_Patron_001_11.text: There's a smuggler's sloop leaving for Waterdeep with two berths left, but the captain wants a fortune for them. This necklace is all I have. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
Exterior_Patron_001_11.context: NodeContext: a bit upset, worried, scared

Exterior_Patron_001_9.speaker: Player
Exterior_Patron_001_9.text: I think the situation here is about to turn around. You should probably stay.

Exterior_Patron_001_35.speaker: Doora Thumbfoot
Exterior_Patron_001_35.text: You think so? I wish I shared your optimism - but I can't, for Maryk's sake. Goodbye.

Exterior_Patron_001_20.speaker: Player
Exterior_Patron_001_20.text: I'm sorry, I can't help you. But your Gortash problem may work itself out.

Exterior_Patron_001_42.speaker: Doora Thumbfoot
Exterior_Patron_001_42.text: I understand. Sorry to bother you, saer. Maybe Maryk will have more luck than I'm having.

Exterior_Patron_001_24.speaker: Player
Exterior_Patron_001_24.text: Oh, the fake jewellery trick's a classic - what's the occasion?

Exterior_Patron_001_17.speaker: Player
Exterior_Patron_001_17.text: Depends, is it fire-proof? Acid-proof? Everything-proof, basically?

Exterior_Patron_001_26.speaker: Doora Thumbfoot
Exterior_Patron_001_26.text: Oh, I'm not sure. But this necklace has stood the test of time - it was my grandmother's. I'll give it you for a bit of coin. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
Exterior_Patron_001_26.context: NodeContext: trying to smile and put on a brave face (she needs to sell this necklace to flee the city, but it's important to her)

Exterior_Patron_001_14.speaker: Doora Thumbfoot
Exterior_Patron_001_14.text: Change your mind about the necklace, saer? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

Patron_010_0.speaker: Truffles Smythe
Patron_010_0.text: Whenever I'm done pushing my broom, you'll find me here wetting my whistle!
Patron_010_0.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the Absolute

Patron_010_1.speaker: Truffles Smythe
Patron_010_1.text: Did you hear? Some adventurers rented out the tavern's whole upper floor. I guess it's back to crashing at Basilisk Gate for me.
Patron_010_1.context: InternalNodeContext: The players paid for exclusive use of Elfsong Tavern first floor.

Patron_010_2.speaker: Truffles Smythe
Patron_010_2.text: Hey, there, Cap'n! Haven't seen you around before. If anyone asks for Truffles, that's me!
Patron_010_2.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the Absolute

Patron_010_3.speaker: Truffles Smythe
Patron_010_3.text: A new archduke. Fancy! We never had one of them before.
Patron_010_3.context: InternalNodeContext: Coronation of Gortash as lord of Baldur's Gate.

Patron_010_4.speaker: Truffles Smythe
Patron_010_4.text: I hear Lorroakan was a greedy old son of a worg. I wonder who got all his loot?
Patron_010_4.context: InternalNodeContext: Lorroakan has been deposed from Ramazith's Tower + no longer owns Sorcerous Sundries

Patron_010_5.speaker: Truffles Smythe
Patron_010_5.text: The rumour is Lord Gortash is dead. I hope to the gods it isn't true.

Patron_010_6.speaker: Truffles Smythe
Patron_010_6.text: Still thinking about asking Rolan, Sundries' new owner, for a job. But what if he's as big a bastard as Lorroakan was?
Patron_010_6.context: InternalNodeContext: Rolan as new owner of Sorcerous Sundries

Patron_010_7.speaker: Truffles Smythe
Patron_010_7.text: The hero returns! Looking for more applause?
Patron_010_7.context: InternalNodeContext: Reputation booster because an article at Baldur's Mouth

Patron_010_8.speaker: Truffles Smythe
Patron_010_8.text: So, ol' Sorc' Sundries has a new owner. I should apply for a job - I'm sick of pushing a broom around Basilisk Gate.
Patron_010_8.context: InternalNodeContext: Rolan as new owner of Sorcerous Sundries

Patron_010_9.speaker: Truffles Smythe
Patron_010_9.text: What the devil was that commotion out in the harbour? Did the Sea Bitch burp?
Patron_010_9.context: InternalNodeContext: Iron Throne Destruction (ie. vague trouble in harbour)

Patron_010_10.speaker: Truffles Smythe
Patron_010_10.text: Wait a minute! You know what? I bet you're the one who's taken over the whole upper floor!
Patron_010_10.context: InternalNodeContext: The players paid for exclusive use of Elfsong Tavern first floor.

Patron_010_11.speaker: Truffles Smythe
Patron_010_11.text: I was pushing my broom at Basilisk Gate when our Steel Watcher just went all limp, like. No one could get it to move. And I hear they're all like that!

Patron_010_12.speaker: Truffles Smythe
Patron_010_12.text: So Lorroakan's gone! He wasn't even in Ramazith's Tower long enough to change its name.
Patron_010_12.context: InternalNodeContext: Lorroakan has been deposed from Ramazith's Tower + no longer owns Sorcerous Sundries

Patron_010_13.speaker: Truffles Smythe
Patron_010_13.text: If you're going to hang around, you should be drinking to the new archduke!
Patron_010_13.context: InternalNodeContext: Coronation of Gortash as lord of Baldur's Gate.

Patron_010_14.speaker: Truffles Smythe
Patron_010_14.text: Well, if it isn't the hero of the hour! At least, that's what I read in the Mouth.
Patron_010_14.context: InternalNodeContext: Reputation booster because an article at Baldur's Mouth

Patron_010_15.speaker: Truffles Smythe
Patron_010_15.text: I'm telling you, I saw it. Out by the chain, the whole surface of Grey Harbour was boiling!
Patron_010_15.context: InternalNodeContext: Iron Throne Destruction (ie. vague trouble in harbour)

Patron_010_16.speaker: Truffles Smythe
Patron_010_16.text: I don't know what knocked out all the Steel Watchers, and I don't want to know. I'm staying inside!

Patron_010_17.speaker: Truffles Smythe
Patron_010_17.text: If Gortash is really gone, I'm not going home sober, I can tell you that.

AD_HarvardWilloughby_1.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
AD_HarvardWilloughby_1.text: You know why they're called Steel Watchers, right? They're watching to see if you're stealing. Heh. Heh?

AD_HarvardWilloughby_3.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
AD_HarvardWilloughby_3.text: What do you get if you cross an owlbear with a bugbear? An... owlbug! Geddit? Hey, would it kill you to laugh a little?

AD_HarvardWilloughby_4.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
AD_HarvardWilloughby_4.text: Asked my wife why she was fooling around with a wizard. She said, 'Mage Hand is a cantrip - he can keep casting it all night long.'

AD_HarvardWilloughby_2.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
AD_HarvardWilloughby_2.text: What's that? Keep it up? That's what she said.

AD_HarvardWilloughby_5.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
AD_HarvardWilloughby_5.text: Hey, you know why it isn't wrong to fart in the Stormshore Tabernacle? It smells divine!

AD_HarvardWilloughby_0.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
AD_HarvardWilloughby_0.text: Whoa-ah! Yeah, I got the kind of thing you like, if you like this kind of thing!

EmperorAD_Sword_0.text: My old sword - my first purchase as an adventurer. No use to me anymore. It's yours, if you want it.

EmperorAD_ReachLair_0.text: My old home - thank you for bringing me back. Look around - you'll find some of my things still intact. Perhaps even useful to you.

AD_Lakrissa_Alfira_0.speaker: Alfira
AD_Lakrissa_Alfira_0.text: Rent is due soon. I was thinking I could do some busking?

AD_Lakrissa_Alfira_6.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_Lakrissa_Alfira_6.text: No need, I picked up some extra shifts.

AD_Lakrissa_Alfira_3.speaker: Alfira
AD_Lakrissa_Alfira_3.text: You didn't have to do that.

AD_Lakrissa_Alfira_4.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_Lakrissa_Alfira_4.text: I know - I wanted to. You just focus on your music.

AD_Lakrissa_Alfira_5.speaker: Alfira
AD_Lakrissa_Alfira_5.text: Rent is due soon. I was thinking I could pick up some shifts at the Elfsong?

AD_Lakrissa_Alfira_14.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_Lakrissa_Alfira_14.text: Are you sure? Alan can be a bit much.

AD_Lakrissa_Alfira_12.speaker: Alfira
AD_Lakrissa_Alfira_12.text: I am - I want to help out.

AD_Lakrissa_Alfira_8.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_Lakrissa_Alfira_8.text: All right - I'll speak to Alan. But if anyone gives you hassle, you come to me.

AD_Lakrissa_Alfira_2.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_Lakrissa_Alfira_2.text: Damn right - and not even pissy druids or cursed shadows could stop us.

AD_Lakrissa_Alfira_9.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_Lakrissa_Alfira_9.text: Nah - you'd have been fine without me. But the company was welcome.

AD_Lakrissa_Alfira_15.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_Lakrissa_Alfira_15.text: A rich arsehole sent his drink back three times - so I spat in his last one.

AD_Lakrissa_Alfira_11.speaker: Alfira
AD_Lakrissa_Alfira_11.context: NodeContext: outraged but also smiling, lakrissa is hilarious

EmperorAD_Wardrove_0.text: My old wardrobe - the home of all my disguises. We are what we appear to be, and so appearances matter.

Skoona_2.speaker: Enforcer Skoona
Skoona_2.text: Welcome, traveller. Remember, this ain't the Blushing Mermaid, it's the Elfsong, so behave yourself.
Skoona_2.context: NodeContext: in bouncer mode - ready for trouble

Skoona_5.speaker: Player
Skoona_5.text: I guess you must be the tavern's hired muscle.

Skoona_1.speaker: Enforcer Skoona
Skoona_1.text: That's right, and a lonely job it is, too. When you're the muscle, no one thinks about your heart.

Skoona_16.speaker: Player
Skoona_16.text: To be honest, you don't look very... approachable.

Skoona_15.speaker: Player
Skoona_15.text: Maybe you should change jobs. Can you sing? A tavern always needs bards.

Skoona_6.speaker: Player
Skoona_6.text: Do you need a pat on the back?

Skoona_10.speaker: Enforcer Skoona
Skoona_10.text: Very funny. Go on inside, they're looking for comedians.

Skoona_3.speaker: Player
Skoona_3.text: Well, I'm thinking about your arms - they're like tree trunks. I approve.

Skoona_11.speaker: Enforcer Skoona
Skoona_11.text: Nice try, but I'd break you in two. Head inside - and have fun.

Skoona_8.speaker: Player
Skoona_8.text: What does it matter what anyone else thinks? You decide your own fate - no one else.

Skoona_13.speaker: Enforcer Skoona
Skoona_13.text: You know what - you're right. Who cares what the punters think? They're all drunks anyway.

Skoona_4.speaker: Player
Skoona_4.text: Leave off the threats. When I'm pushed, I push back.

Skoona_12.speaker: Enforcer Skoona
Skoona_12.text: You want trouble? Take it down to the Guildhall, tough-buckets. Not here.

Skoona_14.speaker: Player
Skoona_14.text: I will - so long as no one messes with me.

Patron_007_SingleDialog_0.speaker: Clovia Throaks
Patron_007_SingleDialog_0.text: Welcome, stranger! If you were hoping to get some of the Elfsong's famous plum rhum, too bad - I just drank the last of it!

Patron_007_SingleDialog_1.speaker: Clovia Throaks
Patron_007_SingleDialog_1.text: I wonder if they've got any plum rhum down at the Mermaid? I know! I'll check the shebeen in the Guildhall.

Cat_001_SwA_5.speaker: Tambourine
Cat_001_SwA_5.text: You were only doing your job, but still, thanks for killing those rats. Now I can repose decorously in peace.

Cat_001_SwA_3.speaker: Tambourine
Cat_001_SwA_3.text: Hello, servant ape. Would you kill those rats, please? Their presence vexes me.

Cat_001_SwA_4.speaker: Tambourine
Cat_001_SwA_4.text: Ah, the servant ape. Hello again.

ComedyTournament_Watcher004_1.speaker: Phantaizha
ComedyTournament_Watcher004_1.text: Hey, I'm keeping out of trouble. Don't draw attention to me, all right?

ComedyTournament_Watcher004_3.speaker: Phantaizha
ComedyTournament_Watcher004_3.text: Look away. Act like you don't know me. Come on, be a pal.

ComedyTournament_Watcher004_5.speaker: Phantaizha
ComedyTournament_Watcher004_5.text: You're a big disappointment, you know that?

ComedyTournament_Watcher004_9.speaker: Phantaizha
ComedyTournament_Watcher004_9.text: You're not really listening to this clown, are you? The lights are much more interesting.

ComedyTournament_Watcher004_4.speaker: Narrator
ComedyTournament_Watcher004_4.text: *You look closely at the young woman - dilated pupils and palpitations. She's a silkroot abuser.*

ComedyTournament_Watcher004_6.speaker: Player
ComedyTournament_Watcher004_6.text: Silkroot is no joke. You should go home - it's not safe to be out and about like this.

ComedyTournament_Watcher004_10.speaker: Phantaizha
ComedyTournament_Watcher004_10.text: Don't get all high and mighty with me, I hear the potions jingling in your pack. Don't talk to me.

ComedyTournament_Watcher004_7.speaker: Player
ComedyTournament_Watcher004_7.text: You're in the wrong place, silkhead. Your kind belong in the back alleys.

ComedyTournament_Watcher004_8.speaker: Phantaizha
ComedyTournament_Watcher004_8.text: Wow. And here I thought you looked like a nice one. Guess I was wrong.

EmperorAD_Remembrance_0.text: The Elfsong Tavern - I wonder if my old things are still there. They could be of use to you.

Patron_009_0.speaker: Blarson Throaks
Patron_009_0.text: I've got it! They're out of plum prosecco here - I bet Clovia's gone to the Mermaid to find some more! Thanks, you jogged my memory.
Patron_009_0.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the Absolute

Patron_009_1.speaker: Blarson Throaks
Patron_009_1.text: Pardon me, little preoccupied, can't talk. Where's Clovia gotten to now? Talking to that minx from the Foundry again, I don't doubt.
Patron_009_1.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the Absolute

EmperorAD_Shell_0.text: A shell - a keepsake from my final voyage. Pinched in a moment of sentimentality.

Patron001_0.speaker: Dame Guisarme
Patron001_0.text: From one warrior to another, I must say, it's just embarrassing the way the Flaming Fist lets this murderer go around killing people and getting away with it.
Patron001_0.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the Absolute

Patron001_10.speaker: Player
Patron001_10.text: You don't think the Fists are up to the task?

Patron001_5.speaker: Dame Guisarme
Patron001_5.text: Oh, they used to be capable enough, but they've gotten slow and lazy. Corruption makes you soft.

Patron001_15.speaker: Player
Patron001_15.text: You think the Flaming Fist have had their day? They might be interested to hear that.

Patron001_4.speaker: Dame Guisarme
Patron001_4.text: Oh, knock it off. You're no friend of the Fists, I can tell just by looking at you. You're more my type. Independent.

Patron001_17.speaker: Dame Guisarme
Patron001_17.text: No, those soft lads will never crack this case the way they're going.

Patron001_6.speaker: Dame Guisarme
Patron001_6.text: And when they fail - and they will, count on it - the Flaming Fists know where to find Dame Guisarme. And then it will be my turn.

Patron001_12.speaker: Player
Patron001_12.text: How would you deal with it?

Patron001_16.speaker: Dame Guisarme
Patron001_16.text: I'd start a special crime unit, a half dozen hard cases, grab some likely losers in the back alleys, and beat on them until we got some answers.

Patron001_7.speaker: Player
Patron001_7.text: The Fists are only good for handling riots. Investigation isn't their strong suit.

Patron001_11.speaker: Dame Guisarme
Patron001_11.text: You don't need subtlety to sort these matters out, just persistence. That's what I told Commander Portyr, anyway.

Patron001_14.speaker: Player
Patron001_14.text: What did the Fist commander have to say to that?

Patron001_3.speaker: Dame Guisarme
Patron001_3.text: Commander Portyr says she already has some 'investigators' she trusts. Soft-talking namby-pambies, I'd wager.

Patron001_9.speaker: Dame Guisarme
Patron001_9.text: But when they fail - and they will, count on it - she knows where to find Dame Guisarme. And then it will be my turn.

Patron001_2.speaker: Dame Guisarme
Patron001_2.text: You don't solve a murder by talk. While you're talking, the killer is out there, killing again.
Patron001_2.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the Absolute

Exterior_Patron_002_0.speaker: Gherva Minedale
Exterior_Patron_002_0.text: Don't give me that look. Even a vigilant follower of Helm is entitled to relax now and then. Briefly.

Exterior_Patron_002_1.speaker: Gherva Minedale
Exterior_Patron_002_1.text: Normally, I wouldn't be hanging around a tavern, but my ne'er-do-well brother Stug told me to meet him here. And now, where is he?

EmperorAD_EmperorStelmaneChair_0.text: | She always sat here when we conducted our business. It pleased me to stand while she laboured. Note the chair is impressive though - all the better to maintain the illusion of control where there was none. Of course, I grew fond of that chair. Even after her death, I never discarded it. It gave me comfort to see her in my mind's eye, sitting there in all her seriousness as I conducted her affairs. |

Patron_013_0.speaker: Wrilda Gemfinder
Patron_013_0.text: Oh, look, the provincial is still around. Taking notes on how the city folk do things?
Patron_013_0.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the Absolute

Patron_013_1.speaker: Wrilda Gemfinder
Patron_013_1.text: I haven't seen you here before. And dressed like that, I doubt I'll see you here again.
Patron_013_1.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the Absolute

Patron_013_2.speaker: Wrilda Gemfinder
Patron_013_2.text: Archduke? Lord Gortash is a trifle young for that, don't you think? Not that anyone cares what you think, or me, for that matter.
Patron_013_2.context: InternalNodeContext: Coronation of Gortash as lord of Baldur's Gate.

Patron_013_3.speaker: Wrilda Gemfinder
Patron_013_3.text: One can only hope that by tomorrow everyone stops talking about Lorroakan's end. So tedious.
Patron_013_3.context: InternalNodeContext: Lorroakan has been deposed from Ramazith's Tower + no longer owns Sorcerous Sundries

Patron_013_4.speaker: Wrilda Gemfinder
Patron_013_4.text: They say that tiresome young man they made Archduke has passed away suddenly. None too soon, if you ask me.

Patron_013_5.speaker: Wrilda Gemfinder
Patron_013_5.text: Though now that I think about it, if there's a new manager at the Sundries, maybe they'll have a sale.
Patron_013_5.context: InternalNodeContext: Rolan as new owner of Sorcerous Sundries

Patron_013_6.speaker: Wrilda Gemfinder
Patron_013_6.text: Shouldn't you be out earning the plaudits of a grateful nation, or something?
Patron_013_6.context: InternalNodeContext: Reputation booster because an article at Baldur's Mouth

Patron_013_7.speaker: Wrilda Gemfinder
Patron_013_7.text: And now Rolan, another jumped-up youngster, is said to be in charge of Sorcerous Sundries! The whole town is following Elturel to hell.
Patron_013_7.context: InternalNodeContext: Rolan as new owner of Sorcerous Sundries

Patron_013_8.speaker: Wrilda Gemfinder
Patron_013_8.text: I was lying down with a headache when that rumbling from the harbour practically threw me to the floor. Swear to Sune.
Patron_013_8.context: InternalNodeContext: Iron Throne Destruction (ie. vague trouble in harbour)

Patron_013_9.speaker: Wrilda Gemfinder
Patron_013_9.text: Everyone acts pleased about the fall of Lorroakan, but he was less tiresome than that old lecher Ramazith. Couldn't keep his paws off my posterior, the cad.
Patron_013_9.context: InternalNodeContext: Lorroakan has been deposed from Ramazith's Tower + no longer owns Sorcerous Sundries

Patron_013_10.speaker: Wrilda Gemfinder
Patron_013_10.text: Was I rude to you before? My manners are quite dreadful, frankly.
Patron_013_10.context: InternalNodeContext: Coronation of Gortash as lord of Baldur's Gate.

Patron_013_11.speaker: Wrilda Gemfinder
Patron_013_11.text: I understand you've done something creditable, though I couldn't be bothered to read the entire article.
Patron_013_11.context: InternalNodeContext: Reputation booster because an article at Baldur's Mouth

Patron_013_12.speaker: Wrilda Gemfinder
Patron_013_12.text: One can hope that after they clear up that mess in the harbour, they'll allow new shipments to come in again. I'm all out of Neverwinter talcum powder.
Patron_013_12.context: InternalNodeContext: Iron Throne Destruction (ie. vague trouble in harbour)

Patron_013_13.speaker: Wrilda Gemfinder
Patron_013_13.text: At least Gortash seemed to have a plan for what to do about these Absolute nuisances.

AD_Skoona_0.speaker: Enforcer Skoona
AD_Skoona_0.text: By Gruumsh! These customers look more ragged every day.

AD_Skoona_1.speaker: Enforcer Skoona
AD_Skoona_1.text: When my break comes, I'm going to play with the kitchen cats, I don't care what Revoor says.

AD_Patron_015_0.speaker: Roger Gherkins
AD_Patron_015_0.text: So Alyth was able to rent out his upper floor! Is that a sign rents will go up, or down?
AD_Patron_015_0.context: InternalNodeContext: The players paid for exclusive use of Elfsong Tavern first floor.

AD_Patron_015_1.speaker: Roger Gherkins
AD_Patron_015_1.text: I should get cards printed. 'Roger Gherkins, Realtor'.
AD_Patron_015_1.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the Absolute

AD_Patron_015_2.speaker: Roger Gherkins
AD_Patron_015_2.text: How do you address an Archduke? Your Excellence? Your Eminence?
AD_Patron_015_2.context: InternalNodeContext: Coronation of Gortash as lord of Baldur's Gate.

AD_Patron_015_3.speaker: Roger Gherkins
AD_Patron_015_3.text: Some harbourfront property might be for sale cheap after that big burp in the bay.
AD_Patron_015_3.context: InternalNodeContext: Iron Throne Destruction (ie. vague trouble in harbour)

Patron_012_0.speaker: 'Ears' Oohna
Patron_012_0.text: Still here, keeping my ear to the ground!
Patron_012_0.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the Absolute

Patron_012_1.speaker: 'Ears' Oohna
Patron_012_1.text: Don't tell me you're the one who rented out the whole upper floor! I hear the beds have been... well used.
Patron_012_1.context: InternalNodeContext: The players paid for exclusive use of Elfsong Tavern first floor.

Patron_012_2.speaker: 'Ears' Oohna
Patron_012_2.text: If you've come to the Elfsong to hear what's going on, never fear, because your girl Oohna hears everything.
Patron_012_2.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the Absolute

Patron_012_3.speaker: 'Ears' Oohna
Patron_012_3.text: That puffed-up parvenu Gortash, an Archduke? However did they find a crown big enough for his head?
Patron_012_3.context: InternalNodeContext: Coronation of Gortash as lord of Baldur's Gate.

Patron_012_4.speaker: 'Ears' Oohna
Patron_012_4.text: Some people are still talking about the fall of Lorroakan, but I am past it.
Patron_012_4.context: InternalNodeContext: Lorroakan has been deposed from Ramazith's Tower + no longer owns Sorcerous Sundries

Patron_012_5.speaker: 'Ears' Oohna
Patron_012_5.text: The whisper is, Lord Gortash is dead! But if someone asks, you didn't hear it from me. Unless that someone has more juicy details!

Patron_012_6.speaker: 'Ears' Oohna
Patron_012_6.text: I must pop over to the Sundries and, um, take in the sights!
Patron_012_6.context: InternalNodeContext: Rolan as new owner of Sorcerous Sundries

Patron_012_7.speaker: 'Ears' Oohna
Patron_012_7.text: If it isn't Good News on legs!
Patron_012_7.context: InternalNodeContext: Reputation booster because an article at Baldur's Mouth

Patron_012_8.speaker: 'Ears' Oohna
Patron_012_8.text: I hear Rolan, the new manager at the Sundries, has two absolutely scrumptious siblings.
Patron_012_8.context: InternalNodeContext: Rolan as new owner of Sorcerous Sundries

Patron_012_9.speaker: 'Ears' Oohna
Patron_012_9.text: Did you hear the great rumbling from Grey Harbour when whatever it was that happened happened? I certainly did. Though of course, I hear everything.
Patron_012_9.context: InternalNodeContext: Iron Throne Destruction (ie. vague trouble in harbour)

Patron_012_10.speaker: 'Ears' Oohna
Patron_012_10.text: Sleeping upstairs? Don't be surprised if you're awakened by the sound of ghostly elven singing!
Patron_012_10.context: InternalNodeContext: The players paid for exclusive use of Elfsong Tavern first floor.

Patron_012_11.speaker: 'Ears' Oohna
Patron_012_11.text: Well, I, for one, won't miss those wretched Steel Watchers. The noise they made! So awful.

Patron_012_12.speaker: 'Ears' Oohna
Patron_012_12.text: Not surprised Lorroakan should take a fall, a trashy dresser like him. No class whatsoever.
Patron_012_12.context: InternalNodeContext: Lorroakan has been deposed from Ramazith's Tower + no longer owns Sorcerous Sundries

Patron_012_13.speaker: 'Ears' Oohna
Patron_012_13.text: Gortash may have made it to the throne, but from what I hear, he won't last long. Can't repeat it, though!
Patron_012_13.context: InternalNodeContext: Coronation of Gortash as lord of Baldur's Gate.

Patron_012_14.speaker: 'Ears' Oohna
Patron_012_14.text: You're responsible for some good news for a change, from what I hear. Keep it up - we can all use some good news.
Patron_012_14.context: InternalNodeContext: Reputation booster because an article at Baldur's Mouth

Patron_012_15.speaker: 'Ears' Oohna
Patron_012_15.text: My ears are still ringing from that commotion in the harbour!
Patron_012_15.context: InternalNodeContext: Iron Throne Destruction (ie. vague trouble in harbour)

Patron_012_16.speaker: 'Ears' Oohna
Patron_012_16.text: I just took a look, and the Steel Watchers are still off-duty, shall we say.

Patron_012_17.speaker: 'Ears' Oohna
Patron_012_17.text: I'm keeping my ears open for more about Gortash's death - if it's true.

AD_Cooker_Assistant_0.speaker: Chef's Assistant Tecochi
AD_Cooker_Assistant_0.text: Someday I'll be the best chef in the city - if the others all leave or die. Ha!

AD_Cooker_Assistant_1.speaker: Chef's Assistant Tecochi
AD_Cooker_Assistant_1.text: This kitchen needs sweeping. Where's that lazy Falten got to?

AD_Cooker_Assistant_2.speaker: Chef's Assistant Tecochi
AD_Cooker_Assistant_2.text: Zit-zit-zot! I love chopping things up. Who doesn't?

AD_Cooker_Assistant_3.speaker: Chef's Assistant Tecochi
AD_Cooker_Assistant_3.text: All this month, no fresh vegetables. Damn the Absolute!

Exterior_Patron_003_0.speaker: Lyldara
Exterior_Patron_003_0.text: The service here is worse than ever. What do you have to do to get a drink around here?

Exterior_Patron_003_1.speaker: Lyldara
Exterior_Patron_003_1.text: The servers aren't paying any attention. I could walk without paying my bill and they'd never notice.

HarvardWilloughby_13.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
HarvardWilloughby_13.text: What do you think? Want to pit your wits in the Laff Riot?
HarvardWilloughby_13.context: NodeContext: eager, wants a bit of a comedy competition to get the crowd going (he is also convinced he's going to win)

HarvardWilloughby_21.speaker: Player
HarvardWilloughby_21.text: I'll bite: what's this Laff Riot?

HarvardWilloughby_31.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
HarvardWilloughby_31.text: It's all about the boffo yocks. We see who can tell the funniest stories, and the winner gets the prize!
HarvardWilloughby_31.context: NodeContext: emphasis on boffo yocks - the creme de la creme of jokes. Eager, over the top.

HarvardWilloughby_30.speaker: Player
HarvardWilloughby_30.text: All right, you're on. It's got to be better than killing rats.

HarvardWilloughby_49.speaker: Player
HarvardWilloughby_49.text: Suits me - I'm pretty good at riots. I'm in.

HarvardWilloughby_15.speaker: Player
HarvardWilloughby_15.text: I'm a bard, Willoughby. Prepare to get served.

HarvardWilloughby_58.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
HarvardWilloughby_58.text: Grrrreat! I'll go first to show you how it's done, and then you see if you can top me.
HarvardWilloughby_58.context: NodeContext: eager, confident - sure he's going to smash this

HarvardWilloughby_26.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
HarvardWilloughby_26.text: Hel-LO, Baldurians! You know, I wouldn't be here tonight, except my wife ran off with a cambion. That's right, I got fiend-zoned.
HarvardWilloughby_26.context: NodeContext: player can have approached from the right or left, so maybe having the comedian square his shoulders, smile and put on his 'performance' facade. He's greeting the crowd, full confident he's gonna smash it. He's a bit of sleaze bag.

HarvardWilloughby_5.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
HarvardWilloughby_5.text: We used to have a drow comedian. I had to ask her to stop casting Tasha's Hideous Laughter on the audience.
HarvardWilloughby_5.context: NodeContext: Sleazy show biz comedian, pleased with himself and certain you're pleased with him too

HarvardWilloughby_10.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
HarvardWilloughby_10.text: Then I asked her how many drow it takes to light a torch, and she said, 'None, we have darkvision.'
HarvardWilloughby_10.context: NodeContext: Sleazy show biz entertainer, pleased with himself and certain you're pleased with him too

HarvardWilloughby_36.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
HarvardWilloughby_36.context: NodeContext: the big punchline to one of his jokes, cheeky sleazy grin

HarvardWilloughby_11.speaker: Narrator
HarvardWilloughby_11.text: *The Elfsong patrons think that one's funny. There may be hope for you yet.*

HarvardWilloughby_29.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
HarvardWilloughby_29.text: Your turn, Smart Stuff. Knock 'em dead! ...But not literally, got me?
HarvardWilloughby_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Comedian steps to one side, and then the player stands up on the stage.NodeContext: turn to player (could be on right or left), still in cheeky comedian mode (last one is delivered like a punchline). Steps to the side so the player can step on the stage

HarvardWilloughby_50.speaker: Player
HarvardWilloughby_50.text: Willoughby the comedian, folks! Were his jokes good, or did he just smell funny?

HarvardWilloughby_6.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
HarvardWilloughby_6.text: Argh! Got me with an ancient jest that's older than I am.

HarvardWilloughby_43.speaker: Player
HarvardWilloughby_43.text: Say, what's the difference between a dwarf and a bulette? You can't toss the bulette!

HarvardWilloughby_1.speaker: Player
HarvardWilloughby_1.text: You know why I hate vampires? They just suck.

HarvardWilloughby_42.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
HarvardWilloughby_42.text: I first heard that one when I was in short pants on the school playground.

HarvardWilloughby_40.speaker: Player
HarvardWilloughby_40.text: I tried sleeping with a dragonborn the other night, but it didn't work out - he had a reptile dysfunction.

HarvardWilloughby_22.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
HarvardWilloughby_22.text: Win or lose, I'm stealing that one.

HarvardWilloughby_44.speaker: Player
HarvardWilloughby_44.text: I asked a zombie reanimator out on a date, but she said she wasn't interested in nec-romance.

HarvardWilloughby_57.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
HarvardWilloughby_57.text: Didn't I tell this joke already?

HarvardWilloughby_14.speaker: Player
HarvardWilloughby_14.text: What does you call a room full of people who don't applaud? Dead.

HarvardWilloughby_2.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
HarvardWilloughby_2.text: Whoa, hang on - this should be against the rules.
HarvardWilloughby_2.context: NodeContext: Unsure (player has threatened crowd to get a laugh)

HarvardWilloughby_4.speaker: Player
HarvardWilloughby_4.text: The Dead Three, am I right? What losers. You know why Bane worshippers will never conquer the world? They don't have the Bhaals!
HarvardWilloughby_4.context: NodeContext: wincing a little, knows it's a no go area for people

HarvardWilloughby_7.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
HarvardWilloughby_7.text: Don't joke about religion, Smart Stuff.
HarvardWilloughby_7.context: NodeContext: a bit of a wince, knows it's always dodgy to joke about these things

HarvardWilloughby_8.speaker: Narrator
HarvardWilloughby_8.text: *Cheers, whistles, and applause. You're almost shocked.*
HarvardWilloughby_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: No need to show the people, only the sound

HarvardWilloughby_12.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
HarvardWilloughby_12.text: Yeah, yeah, you're hilarious. Now get out of here before I lose my job.

HarvardWilloughby_9.speaker: Narrator
