HarvardWilloughby_9.text: *A single person applauds from the back of the room - probably out of pity.*
HarvardWilloughby_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: No need to show the people, only the sounds

HarvardWilloughby_37.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
HarvardWilloughby_37.text: Sorry, Smart Stuff. No joy for you, I'm afraid, but that sounds like job security for me.

HarvardWilloughby_18.speaker: Player
HarvardWilloughby_18.text: A mind flayer's duergar slave lost his nose, so I asked the illithid, 'How does he smell?' and it said, 'I have eaten its brain.'

HarvardWilloughby_28.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
HarvardWilloughby_28.context: NodeContext: grimacing, player delivered a terrible joke

HarvardWilloughby_19.speaker: Player
HarvardWilloughby_19.text: Our cleric tried to cast Healing Word on a ham, but it was already cured.

HarvardWilloughby_47.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
HarvardWilloughby_47.text: Pig jokes are never wrong. Well done.

HarvardWilloughby_59.speaker: Player
HarvardWilloughby_59.text: CLAP, OR I'LL RIP OUT YOUR SPINES.

HarvardWilloughby_56.speaker: Player
HarvardWilloughby_56.text: Hey! I asked my wizard to cast Shatter. He said, 'Shatter? I hardly know 'er!'

HarvardWilloughby_61.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
HarvardWilloughby_61.text: If that's the best you've got, Smart Stuff, you should quit before the crowd gets angry.
HarvardWilloughby_61.context: NodeContext: secretly pleased the player is bombng

HarvardWilloughby_52.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
HarvardWilloughby_52.text: An interesting technique, but all right.
HarvardWilloughby_52.context: NodeContext: Unsure (player has threatened crowd to get a laugh)

HarvardWilloughby_38.speaker: Narrator
HarvardWilloughby_38.text: *A single person applauds frantically from the back.*

HarvardWilloughby_16.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
HarvardWilloughby_16.text: Sorry, Smart Stuff - threats ain't comedy, no matter how brawny you are. But thanks for the job security.

HarvardWilloughby_23.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
HarvardWilloughby_23.text: Second best? Me? Maybe it's time for this old boy to find a new grift.

HarvardWilloughby_32.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
HarvardWilloughby_32.text: Hey, Smart Stuff, I'm Willoughby the comedian, and we got a little contest here called the Laff Riot. You want to play along?

HarvardWilloughby_35.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
HarvardWilloughby_35.text: Another triumph! Yes indeedy, I'm still the comedy king!

AD_Lakrissa_0.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_Lakrissa_0.text: Break time! Heading to the roof - sort your own drinks in the meantime.
AD_Lakrissa_0.context: NodeContext: calling out - general announcement to the pub. Cheerful and cheeky

AD_Lakrissa_1.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_Lakrissa_1.text: Drink orders people - yell it or lose it!

AD_Lakrissa_2.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_Lakrissa_2.text: A reminder that this isn't the Blushing Mermaid. Any roughhousing and you're OUT.

AD_Lakrissa_3.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_Lakrissa_3.text: Where were some of these fancy folk raised? A bloody pig pen?
AD_Lakrissa_3.context: NodeContext: looking at the state of table (not guaranteed as she will be walking/stopping randomly, but more to let you know the vibe of the line)

AD_Lakrissa_4.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_Lakrissa_4.text: You want your drink faster? Well, I like big tips - just saying.
AD_Lakrissa_4.context: NodeContext: trying not to sound exasperated by a difficult customer

Patron_008_22.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
Patron_008_22.text: Another? Should I have another? Ilmater preserve me, I need the courage.

Patron_008_21.speaker: Player
Patron_008_21.text: Will another drink solve your problems?

Patron_008_52.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
Patron_008_52.text: No, saer. We abandoned our farm when the Absolute army marched in.

Patron_008_8.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
Patron_008_8.text: We used to sell our barley to the brewer who makes this very beer. That's all over now.

Patron_008_33.speaker: Player
Patron_008_33.text: You must be furious at the Absolute cult and their army.

Patron_008_46.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
Patron_008_46.text: Why? No more point to that than getting mad at a plague of locusts, or the weather.

Patron_008_7.speaker: Player
Patron_008_7.text: Did  you try to fight back?

Patron_008_27.speaker: Player
Patron_008_27.text: What will you country folk do here in the city?

Patron_008_58.speaker: Player
Patron_008_58.text: There's always room for anger. Especially in times like these.

Patron_008_36.speaker: Player
Patron_008_36.text: I'm sure you'll find a new trade soon enough. There's plenty about.

Patron_008_38.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
Patron_008_38.text: I'm not so sure. What good can these farmer hands do in a city like this? Besides, I've got the others to think of.

Patron_008_41.speaker: Player
Patron_008_41.text: You won't find courage in the bottom of a bottle.

Patron_008_49.speaker: Player
Patron_008_49.text: Drink up! This city is living on borrowed time.
Patron_008_49.context: InternalNodeContext: Tags checked on the rules inside the node

Patron_008_6.speaker: Player
Patron_008_6.text: The answer is yes - it's always yes.

Patron_008_3.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
Patron_008_3.text: No, I guess I've had enough. The brewer who made this beer used to buy all of our barley. But that's over now.

Patron_008_16.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
Patron_008_16.text: Left the crops standing in the fields when we ran from the Absolute army. Gone, all gone.

Patron_008_18.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
Patron_008_18.text: If it were only me it wouldn't be so bad, but I've got mouths to feed.

Patron_008_53.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
Patron_008_53.text: Family's upstairs, exhausted. I'm Dez Kanshaw - with a wife, two kids, and another on the way.

Patron_008_15.speaker: Player
Patron_008_15.text: But you had enough left for a drink.

Patron_008_26.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
Patron_008_26.text: One - and I shouldn't have had even that. Got work to do.

Patron_008_5.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
Patron_008_5.text: Oldest boy, Korson, he means well but he eats as much as the rest of us put together. I have to find him a place here.

Patron_008_30.speaker: Player
Patron_008_30.text: There's a war on. Can he fight?

Patron_008_50.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
Patron_008_50.text: We're farmers, not fighters. That's not the answer for us.

Patron_008_11.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
Patron_008_11.text: Oldest boy, Korson, he means well but he eats as much as the rest of us put together. I have to find him a place here.

Patron_008_34.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
Patron_008_34.text: A fancy feller called Three-Piece wants to place him as a cleaner in the Counting House. But I don't trust him.

Patron_008_28.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
Patron_008_28.text: Maybe I should just join the Flaming Fist and take the signing bonus. What else can I do?

Patron_008_1.speaker: Player
Patron_008_1.text: Three-Piece sounds like a crook. Better if you join the Fists.

Patron_008_40.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
Patron_008_40.text: That's what I was thinking too. Was drinking to get up the courage to do it.

Patron_008_0.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
Patron_008_0.text: But it's hard, because it means goodbye to our family's farm. Korson will never work those fields.

Patron_008_19.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
Patron_008_19.text: Thanks, stranger, you helped settle my mind. Thanks are all I have to offer, though. May Ilmater bleed for you.

Patron_008_4.speaker: Player
Patron_008_4.text: That cleaner job sounds steady. Leaves you available to head back to the farm.

Patron_008_44.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
Patron_008_44.text: Right. It's taking a chance, but it's worth the risk. The farm is all we have, really.

Patron_008_55.speaker: Player
Patron_008_55.text: I hear the Ilmater temple at Wyrm's needs volunteers. They don't pay, but at least the boy will eat.

Patron_008_43.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
Patron_008_43.text: Huh. That's a solid tip. Could work out for a gentle kid like Korson.

Patron_008_48.speaker: Player
Patron_008_48.text: The Thieves Guild are always on the lookout for talent. He'd never run out of work.

Patron_008_51.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
Patron_008_51.text: My gentle boy? A thief? I wouldn't have dared think of it before, but... maybe the Guild isn't a bad place to look.

Patron_008_14.speaker: Player
Patron_008_14.text: Forget the city - the wilds have everything you need.

Patron_008_17.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
Patron_008_17.text: Huh - that's true. And we're no strangers to working the land.

Patron_008_12.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
Patron_008_12.text: Korson's strong, but he's a gentle soul. Easy to take advantage of.

Patron_008_47.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
Patron_008_47.text: A fancy feller called Three-Piece wants to place Korson as a cleaner in the Counting House. But I don't trust him.

Patron_008_42.speaker: Player
Patron_008_42.text: If he can't find his own place, perhaps he doesn't deserve one.

Patron_008_9.speaker: Player
Patron_008_9.text: Life is meant for living! The boy must find his own path, as I did. As we all must.

Patron_008_29.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
Patron_008_29.text: I appreciate that some might find me a soft touch, but he's my son. I'll make no apology for looking out for him.

Patron_008_24.speaker: Player
Patron_008_24.text: Well good luck to you and your family.

Patron_008_57.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
Patron_008_57.text: Thank you kindly. And to you and yours.

Patron_008_13.speaker: Player
Patron_008_13.text: Of course, deep courage comes from a full belly.

Patron_008_23.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
Patron_008_23.text: You look as out of place here as I feel.

Patron_008_32.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
Patron_008_32.text: What say you, should I have another? Ilmater preserve me, I need the courage.

Patron_008_37.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
Patron_008_37.text: Thanks again, stranger. Ilmater guide you.

PAD_TryGoCamp_0.speaker: Player
PAD_TryGoCamp_0.text: I wonder if any of these rooms are available to rent?

AD_Exterior_Patron_007_3.speaker: Saer Frenello
AD_Exterior_Patron_007_3.text: Event planner for the Auld Patriars' Club! I'll never have a job that good again.

AD_Exterior_Patron_007_5.speaker: Rowan Elkfriend
AD_Exterior_Patron_007_5.text: I know it. Everyone knows it. You won't shut up about it.

AD_Exterior_Patron_007_4.speaker: Rowan Elkfriend
AD_Exterior_Patron_007_4.text: Did you hear that? Lord Gortash has been killed! Who would do such a thing?

AD_Exterior_Patron_007_0.speaker: Saer Frenello
AD_Exterior_Patron_007_0.text: Whoever it was, they did me a big favour! The council is going to need to plan a state funeral.

AD_Exterior_Patron_007_10.speaker: Rowan Elkfriend
AD_Exterior_Patron_007_10.text: Of course. And here you are, an event planner just looking for work.

AD_Exterior_Patron_007_2.speaker: Saer Frenello
AD_Exterior_Patron_007_2.text: Exactly! As soon as I gather my wits, I'm off to Wyrm's Rock to offer my expert services.

AD_Exterior_Patron_007_7.speaker: Saer Frenello
AD_Exterior_Patron_007_7.text: As my friend, you should help me find a new job.

AD_Exterior_Patron_007_1.speaker: Rowan Elkfriend
AD_Exterior_Patron_007_1.text: Just because I lend you money sometimes doesn't make me your friend.
AD_Exterior_Patron_007_1.context: NodeContext: patiently explaining to an idiot.

AD_Exterior_Patron_007_9.speaker: Saer Frenello
AD_Exterior_Patron_007_9.text: I know! I'll plan a jobs fair event so I can find myself a new job.

AD_Exterior_Patron_007_6.speaker: Rowan Elkfriend
AD_Exterior_Patron_007_6.text: Whoa, Frenello, that's brilliant. Or stupid. One of those.

AD_Exterior_Patron_007_11.speaker: Rowan Elkfriend
AD_Exterior_Patron_007_11.text: I'm fed up with this brown-ass town. I'm going back to the woods.

AD_Exterior_Patron_007_8.speaker: Saer Frenello
AD_Exterior_Patron_007_8.text: The woods! Do you think they could use an event planner there?

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_85.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_85.text: Lae'zel. Glad you could join us.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_41.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_41.text: It seems your report was good, W'wargaz. Glad you could join us, Lae'zel.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_117.speaker: Lae'zel
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_117.text: Stand down! It is on our queen's sacred order that I keep the Prism close.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_136.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_136.text: The Undying Queen cares not for who delivers her the Prism and the traitor prince within.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_127.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_127.text: All that matters is that it is delivered.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_147.speaker: Lae'zel
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_147.text: Stand down - I protect the Prism on our queen's behalf!

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_139.speaker: Lae'zel
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_139.text: This artefact contains the key to our freedom. It is not for the lich queen to take!

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_124.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_124.text: I know exactly what the Prism contains. The traitor prince who would hand us to ghaik.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_22.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_22.text: The false heir's head will make a fine trophy for Vlaakith. As for you -

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_144.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_144.text: - I will leave nothing behind but meat and shattered bone.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_138.speaker: Player
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_138.text: Strike me and die, a failed warrior forgotten by your people.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_15.speaker: Player
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_15.text: Vlaakith entrusted Lae'zel with the Prism. Interfere, and the queen's sure to punish you.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_5.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_5.text: And you, Lae'zel - a child, an unascended - would snatch my glory for herself.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_66.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_66.text: You may keep your head. But I will yet be exalted. I will yet see my name carved in slate.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_48.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_48.context: NodeContext: Confidently, but not as a battle cry. VLAH-kith-kah SIV-im HRATH KRAHSH-het. Only in Vlaakith may we find light.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_89.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_89.text: Damnable whelp. For a thousand years have I given my life to Vlaakith.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_70.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_70.text: I will deliver to her the Prince of the Comet. She shall exalt me. The gish will record my great deed in slate!

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_76.speaker: Player
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_76.text: I'd give the artefact to you freely, but it isn't possible.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_137.speaker: Player
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_137.text: Orpheus is the githyanki's true prince. You will not take him.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_164.speaker: Player
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_164.text: Orpheus is the githyanki's true prince. You will not take him.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_34.speaker: Player
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_34.text: Orpheus lives. The empire will be his.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_16.speaker: Player
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_16.text: Orpheus lives. The empire will be his.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_47.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_47.text: Gith's wretched son will be the fall of the githyanki.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_31.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_31.text: It seems your report was good, W'wargaz.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_13.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_13.text: Here you are, as brazen as described.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_106.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_106.text: The gloomed soul who thieved from our queen.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_154.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_154.text: The gloomed soul who thieved from our queen.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_77.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_77.text: The traitor who would steal from our queen.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_90.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_90.text: Of course, you had help, didn't you? From the illithid you carry inside the Astral Prism.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_97.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_97.text: How quaint that we should meet here - in the very place that it once called home.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_145.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_145.text: We know all about the 'Emperor' and its dealings with you. Though I must confess its peculiar relationship with you threw us off course for a while.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_156.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_156.text: Most illithids prefer to dominate their thralls through transformation, yet here you stand, only partially transformed.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_86.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_86.text: Most illithids prefer to dominate their thralls through transformation, yet here you stand, untransformed.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_105.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_105.text: Tell me - what did it offer you in exchange for your servitude?

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_92.speaker: Player
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_92.text: How did you know about that?

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_28.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_28.text: Have you quite forgotten what and who we are, kin?

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_11.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_11.text: Mind flayers are our quarry. We have filled libraries with our knowledge of how to hunt them down.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_14.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_14.text: We tracked it from the moment the Astral Prism fell into its claws.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_20.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_20.text: And now that we have found it, we will reclaim the Astral Prism, purge it of the illithid interloper, and restore it to its rightful owner.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_30.speaker: Player
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_30.text: You should know the Emperor is not the only occupant of the Astral Prism.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_99.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_99.text: My dear child, I already know all there is to know.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_39.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_39.text: I will liberate you from your puppet-master. Ch'mar, zal'a Vlaakith!
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_39.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith's will above all! shouted as combat rally

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_121.speaker: Player
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_121.text: I'd give it to you freely, if the mind flayer would let me.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_110.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_110.text: Ha! I see it keeps you on a tight leash. Very good.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_56.speaker: Player
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_56.text: I'd give it to you freely, if it were possible to do so.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_122.text: I will remember you said that.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_27.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_27.text: I was not asking for it. Htak'a!

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_88.speaker: Player
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_88.text: I've fought stronger, faster, and more accomplished warriors than you. You cannot win.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_4.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_4.text: Death will be yours and yours alone, ghaik slave. Htak'a!

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_59.speaker: Player
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_59.text: I'll send you home in your own box!

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_98.speaker: Player
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_98.text: The promise of defeating the elder brain.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_148.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_148.text: And you would trust an illithid to do such a thing?

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_120.speaker: Player
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_120.text: I serve one far greater than any illithid. We are merely allies.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_111.speaker: Player
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_111.text: There's no servitude - the illithid is my ally.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_135.speaker: Player
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_135.text: My people served the illithid once - never again. We are allies.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_26.speaker: Player
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_26.text: My people answer to none but Gruumsh. We are merely allies.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_49.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_49.text: I thought you said this one was smart, W'wargaz?
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_49.context: CinematicNodeContext: addressed to W'wargazNodeContext: sneering

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_114.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_114.text: You have fallen prey to its manipulation.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_104.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_104.text: Your story ends here. We will reclaim the Astral Prism, purge it of the illithid interloper, and restore it to our queen.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_38.speaker: Player
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_38.text: I serve none other than the wild tempest that is nature. We are merely allies.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_113.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_113.text: It seems your report was good, W'wargaz. Glad you could join us, Lae'zel.
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_113.context: CinematicNodeContext: addressed to W'wargaz, then Lae'zel

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_65.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_65.text: I'm told you carry an artefact most cherished.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_75.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_75.text: An artefact our venerable queen would stop at nothing to take back.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_102.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_102.text: Tell me, Lae'zel of K'liir. What reward do you think the Astral Prism will fetch once I pluck it from your corpse and present it to Vlaakith?

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_67.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_67.text: What honours, what riches, will the Undying Queen grant me when I hand her the failed prince?

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_69.speaker: Player
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_69.text: Strike me and die, a failed warrior forgotten by your people.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_125.speaker: Player
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_125.text: The queen has entrusted me with the Prism. Interfere, and death will be her reward to you.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_62.speaker: Player
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_62.text: The queen has entrusted me with the Prism. Interfere, and death will be her reward to you.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_18.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_18.text: And you - this child, this unascended - would snatch my glory for yourself.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_37.speaker: Player
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_37.text: I'd give the artefact to you freely, but it isn't possible.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_91.speaker: Player
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_91.text: This artefact contains our people's future. I won't let you take it.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_73.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_73.text: Dearest Lae'zel. You've fallen victim to a manipulation. The traitor prince would lead us to ruin.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_78.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_78.text: Your story ends here. We will reclaim the Astral Prism and restore it to our queen.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_43.speaker: Player
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_43.text: You cannot best me. You will die here, and your legacy will die with you.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_25.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_25.text: The traitor prince will be the fall of the githyanki.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_129.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_129.text: Vlaakith will not have your head today. But have it, she will.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_100.speaker: Player
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_100.text: Orpheus lives. The empire will be his.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_115.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_115.text: Lae'zel. Glad you could join us.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_82.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_82.text: The kith'raki have spread word of that artefact that you carry.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_140.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_140.text: Lae'zel. So you decided to make your appearance.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_63.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_63.text: It seems your report was good, W'wargaz.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_107.speaker: Player
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_107.text: Stand down! It is on our Queen's sacred order that I keep the Prism close.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_87.speaker: Player
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_87.text: Stand down - I protect the Prism on our queen's behalf!

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_50.speaker: Player
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_50.text: This artefact contains the key to our freedom. It is not for the lich queen to take!

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_109.speaker: Player
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_109.text: The queen has entrusted me with the Prism. Interfere, and death will be her only gift to you.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_44.speaker: Player
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_44.text: Strike me and die - a failed warrior forgotten by our people.

Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_143.speaker: Player
Githyanki_InquisitorInterrogation_143.text: Orpheus lives. The empire will be his.

Inkeeper_19.speaker: Alan Alyth
Inkeeper_19.text: Welcome back. What can I do you for?

Inkeeper_33.speaker: Player
Inkeeper_33.text: I'm still looking for somewhere to stay.

Inkeeper_29.speaker: Alan Alyth
Inkeeper_29.text: Well, the price ain't changed. Pockets deep enough? ([LOW_Elfsong_RentFullPrice_522a449e-a7f5-0d9b-c835-fc5a24d49d65])

Inkeeper_75.speaker: Alan Alyth
Inkeeper_75.text: Commiserations. Perhaps a pint'll soothe your sorrows?

Inkeeper_66.speaker: Player
Inkeeper_66.text: I'm looking for a place to stay.

Inkeeper_1.speaker: Alan Alyth
Inkeeper_1.text: Tell you what - the murder upstairs has brought some punters, but it's also really spooked folk out of renting rooms.

Inkeeper_50.speaker: Alan Alyth
Inkeeper_50.text: If we get you staying up there, perhaps folk'll calm down and realise there's nowt to worry about.

Inkeeper_68.speaker: Alan Alyth
Inkeeper_68.text: You can have the whole upstairs floor until this killer thing blows over. ([LOW_Elfsong_RentFullPrice_522a449e-a7f5-0d9b-c835-fc5a24d49d65])

Inkeeper_35.speaker: Player
Inkeeper_35.text: You're optimistic. What makes you so sure it'll all blow over?

Inkeeper_95.speaker: Alan Alyth
Inkeeper_95.text: The City always wins. There's always some hero that saves the day. It's the way things work.

Inkeeper_27.speaker: Player
Inkeeper_27.text: Perhaps I could get a discount on the accommodation?

Inkeeper_88.speaker: Alan Alyth
Inkeeper_88.text: Hah! Charity, in Baldur's Gate? Good one.

Inkeeper_13.speaker: Player
Inkeeper_13.text: You want [LOW_Elfsong_RentFullPrice_522a449e-a7f5-0d9b-c835-fc5a24d49d65] gold to sleep next to a murder scene? Really?

Inkeeper_81.speaker: Alan Alyth
Inkeeper_81.text: (Keep your voice down about the bloody murder upstairs!) Ahem.

Inkeeper_40.speaker: Player
Inkeeper_40.text: If I'm staying in this place, I'll make sure to protect it.

Inkeeper_92.speaker: Alan Alyth
Inkeeper_92.text: You will protect it? Have you seen some of the big bastards around here?

Inkeeper_8.speaker: Alan Alyth
Inkeeper_8.text: The price just went up. Call it a shite-talk surcharge. ([LOW_Elfsong_RentOverpriced_c0839c4d-1481-70c1-e5c0-5a0aeaef4fb5])

Inkeeper_53.speaker: Alan Alyth
Inkeeper_53.text: Top floor's all yours. If it gets a bit too noisy at night, well, don't sleep above a pub.

Inkeeper_54.speaker: Alan Alyth
Inkeeper_54.text: If you happen across some coinage, you know where to find me.

Inkeeper_16.speaker: Alan Alyth
Inkeeper_16.text: Insurance like that is mighty valuable at the moment. Sounds good to me.

Inkeeper_18.speaker: Player
Inkeeper_18.text: Point out the tavern's obvious dirt and grime - that should get you a discount.

Inkeeper_49.speaker: Alan Alyth
Inkeeper_49.text: Oi, oi! I've got a good thing going here - don't need you casting nasty aspersions. You can have it free if you shut your maw.

Inkeeper_79.speaker: Alan Alyth
Inkeeper_79.text: It's called character. Anyone will tell you that.

Inkeeper_43.speaker: Player
Inkeeper_43.text: I'm with the Guild. You'll be giving me the Nine-Finger discount.

Inkeeper_23.speaker: Alan Alyth
Inkeeper_23.text: Look, mate, I don't want any trouble. Especially not from your lot.

Inkeeper_10.speaker: Alan Alyth
Inkeeper_10.text: Pull the other one - Guild folk don't chuck around Nine-Fingers' name like cheap dice.

Inkeeper_26.speaker: Player
Inkeeper_26.text: Cut the price, and I'll spread word of this place for miles around.

Inkeeper_87.speaker: Alan Alyth
Inkeeper_87.text: What good is your word? Invasion, murders, and lack of cash is what's putting folks off renting rooms.

Inkeeper_91.speaker: Alan Alyth
Inkeeper_91.text: More arses in chairs means more coin in my pouch. You've got yourself a deal.

Inkeeper_56.speaker: Alan Alyth
Inkeeper_56.text: All right, ALL RIGHT! Calm down, you mad bastard.

Inkeeper_86.speaker: Player
Inkeeper_86.text: I could wave my hand and turn this place into rubble.

Inkeeper_41.speaker: Alan Alyth
Inkeeper_41.text: That'd be a great threat - if you weren't in the building too, genius.

Inkeeper_9.speaker: Player
Inkeeper_9.text: Recite Elminster's journal entry about his free stay at the Elfsong Tavern.

Inkeeper_46.speaker: Alan Alyth
Inkeeper_46.text: Two little mistakes, pal. One - he actually stayed here in 1310 DR. Two - you're not Elminster. Bloody wizards.

Inkeeper_2.speaker: Alan Alyth
Inkeeper_2.text: You can have it for free if you stop talking. Bloody wizards.

Inkeeper_55.speaker: Player
Inkeeper_55.text: Have you got anything to trade?

Inkeeper_74.speaker: Alan Alyth
Inkeeper_74.text: It's been slim pickings since the Absolute butchered that supply convoy - but have a look.

Inkeeper_30.speaker: Narrator
Inkeeper_30.text: *News of your good deeds has travelled fast. The merchant is all too happy to extend a certain generosity towards you, where the price of goods is concerned.*

Inkeeper_34.speaker: Narrator
Inkeeper_34.text: *Your notoriety precedes you. Prices have been moderated to reflect your less-than-welcome presence in the city.*

Inkeeper_38.speaker: Player
Inkeeper_38.text: Tell me more about the murder.

Inkeeper_28.speaker: Alan Alyth
Inkeeper_28.text: Going to make this place famous, I reckon. Victim is a bloody duke - Belynne Stelmane. Well, she was a duke. Now she's just bloody.

Inkeeper_32.speaker: Alan Alyth
Inkeeper_32.text: I reckon I'll be able to charge double for that room once the Constable's done with it. Murders and ghosts are always grand for business.

Inkeeper_31.speaker: Alan Alyth
Inkeeper_31.text: Oi oi, pull up a seat - if you can find one spare, that is!

Inkeeper_15.speaker: Alan Alyth
Inkeeper_15.text: With all this talk of war - what else are folk to do but drink?

Inkeeper_0.speaker: Alan Alyth
Inkeeper_0.text: I reckon the murder we had's something to do with it too. Got punters all intrigued. On that morbid note - what can I get your fine self?

EmperorAD_AfterKillGithyanki_1.text: Good. Peace at last. Now look behind the statue - there's a way through. I'll reveal the mechanism to you.

EmperorAD_AfterKillGithyanki_2.text: Vlaakith is relentless. You handled it well. Let us hope she exhausts her forces soon.

EmperorAD_AfterKillGithyanki_0.text: Now search the room. There's a statue that conceals the way through. I'll reveal it to you.

EmperorAD_AfterKillGithyanki_3.text: They tracked the artefact all this way... you handled them well.

Alfira_Lakrisssa_3.speaker: Alfira
Alfira_Lakrisssa_3.text: I'll never get tired of this view.
Alfira_Lakrisssa_3.context: NodeContext: looking out at the view in front of her - a big smile on her face

Alfira_Lakrisssa_5.speaker: Lakrissa
Alfira_Lakrisssa_5.context: NodeContext: looking at alfira, loving smile on her face

Alfira_Lakrisssa_12.speaker: Lakrissa
Alfira_Lakrisssa_12.text: Ah - you found my hiding spot. Not a word to Alan, he doesn't believe in things like 'breaks' or 'eating'.

Alfira_Lakrisssa_9.speaker: Alfira
Alfira_Lakrisssa_9.text: Lakrissa, I'd be more than happy to help you out at work. I could -

Alfira_Lakrisssa_1.speaker: Lakrissa
Alfira_Lakrisssa_1.text: No - focus on your music. Besides, I'll be living a life of luxury when your school takes off.

Alfira_Lakrisssa_13.speaker: Player
Alfira_Lakrisssa_13.text: You two are very cute together.

Alfira_Lakrisssa_11.speaker: Lakrissa
Alfira_Lakrisssa_11.text: Right? I keep telling her that.
Alfira_Lakrisssa_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: looks at alfiraNodeContext: flirting, looking at alfira

Alfira_Lakrisssa_4.speaker: Player
Alfira_Lakrisssa_4.text: If you need help, just say the word.

Alfira_Lakrisssa_10.speaker: Lakrissa
Alfira_Lakrisssa_10.text: No need - I'm looking after my girl, Alfira. Isn't that right, sweetie pie?
Alfira_Lakrisssa_10.context: NodeContext: wink and nudge at alfira, teasing her

Alfira_Lakrisssa_8.speaker: Lakrissa
Alfira_Lakrisssa_8.text: All right, the hero and I will stop teasing. For now.
Alfira_Lakrisssa_8.context: NodeContext: hands up as if in joke surrender. Wink at player at 'for now'

Alfira_Lakrisssa_7.speaker: Player
Alfira_Lakrisssa_7.text: Get back to work, or I'll tell Alan.

Alfira_Lakrisssa_0.speaker: Lakrissa
Alfira_Lakrisssa_0.text: Why don't you get off my back, and enjoy the view, hero? Who knows - it might help you be less of a grump.
Alfira_Lakrisssa_0.context: NodeContext: biting but also teasing - she can handle the player

AD_Reevor_0.speaker: Chef Roveer
AD_Reevor_0.text: Why so much business today? Don't customers know there's a war on?

AD_Reevor_1.speaker: Chef Roveer
AD_Reevor_1.text: Tired of cooking, tired of rats. I need to quit, or take a vacation, or both.
AD_Reevor_1.context: InternalNodeContext: Planned: adding behavior to make Revoor play with the cats

AD_Reevor_2.speaker: Chef Roveer
AD_Reevor_2.text: Look at you, just lying around, you furry chonkers! Disgraceful.

AD_Reevor_3.speaker: Chef Roveer
AD_Reevor_3.text: Time to start the stirge fricassee, I guess.

AD_Reevor_4.speaker: Chef Roveer
AD_Reevor_4.text: So, you cats can catch yarn ball but not rats? Worthless!
AD_Reevor_4.context: InternalNodeContext: Planned: adding behavior to make Revoor play with the cats

AD_Reevor_5.speaker: Chef Roveer
AD_Reevor_5.text: No time for playing with cats! Especially lazy lumps that won't catch rats.
AD_Reevor_5.context: InternalNodeContext: Planned: adding behavior to make Revoor play with the cats

Yimuir_0.speaker: Waiter Yimuir
Yimuir_0.text: See Alan at the bar for drinks. I'm busier than a two-peckered goat.

Yimuir_1.speaker: Waiter Yimuir
Yimuir_1.text: Tymora's tonsils! I'm even busier than before.

Exterior_Patron_004_0.speaker: Vinshent Fenteman
Exterior_Patron_004_0.text: When I think about the poor refugees starving in Rivington, I could just weep. I believe I'll drown my tears in another brandy.

Exterior_Patron_004_1.speaker: Vinshent Fenteman
Exterior_Patron_004_1.text: Brandy is the cure for most ills, I do believe.

AD_GithyankiShield_Paladin_Turn2_0.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
AD_GithyankiShield_Paladin_Turn2_0.context: NodeContext: cheh-MAR ZAL-a VLA-kith (Vlaakith's will above all)

Patron_015_0.speaker: Roger Gherkins
Patron_015_0.text: You've got the look of someone's who's ready to buy! When the time comes, look for me - Roger Gherkins!
Patron_015_0.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the Absolute

Patron_015_1.speaker: Roger Gherkins
Patron_015_1.text: I hear you rented the upper floor - went straight through Alan Alyth. You big dummy, you should have talked to me first, I could've got you a bargain rate!
Patron_015_1.context: InternalNodeContext: The players paid for exclusive use of Elfsong Tavern first floor.

Patron_015_2.speaker: Roger Gherkins
Patron_015_2.text: The times are grim, I know, but I tell you what, grim times are the best times to invest in real estate.
Patron_015_2.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the Absolute

Patron_015_3.speaker: Roger Gherkins
Patron_015_3.text: Gortash, Archduke of Baldur's Gate! I hear he's moved into the penthouse at Wyrm's Rock. That place must cost a fortune, per diem.
Patron_015_3.context: InternalNodeContext: Coronation of Gortash as lord of Baldur's Gate.

Patron_015_4.speaker: Roger Gherkins
Patron_015_4.text: Wait, how did Lorroakan acquire the tower from Ramazith in the first place? Was there a proper transfer of deed? There could be opportunities here.
Patron_015_4.context: InternalNodeContext: Lorroakan has been deposed from Ramazith's Tower + no longer owns Sorcerous Sundries

Patron_015_5.speaker: Roger Gherkins
Patron_015_5.text: Word on the street is that Gortash has passed away from a sudden ailment. I wonder who will be renting out the Wyrm's Rock penthouse now?

Patron_015_6.speaker: Roger Gherkins
Patron_015_6.text: Sorcerous Sundries, what am I thinking? It's Ramazith's Tower that's the real prime real estate in this transaction!
Patron_015_6.context: InternalNodeContext: Rolan as new owner of Sorcerous Sundries

Patron_015_7.speaker: Roger Gherkins
Patron_015_7.text: Keep me in mind - Roger Gherkins, your Baldur's Gate realtor!
Patron_015_7.context: InternalNodeContext: Reputation booster because an article at Baldur's Mouth

Patron_015_8.speaker: Roger Gherkins
Patron_015_8.text: Rolan may be the new manager of Sorcerous Sundries, but what I want to know is, who holds the mortgage on that place? They might be looking to refinance. I should check at the Counting House.
Patron_015_8.context: InternalNodeContext: Rolan as new owner of Sorcerous Sundries

Patron_015_9.speaker: Roger Gherkins
Patron_015_9.text: Whatever happened out in Grey Harbour, the waves made a mess of the waterfront housing in Brampton! Might be able to snap up a few bargains.
Patron_015_9.context: InternalNodeContext: Iron Throne Destruction (ie. vague trouble in harbour)

Patron_015_10.speaker: Roger Gherkins
Patron_015_10.text: Look, if you find anything that's not quite right about your rental property, let me know. I'll get Alan to shave the price for you.
Patron_015_10.context: InternalNodeContext: The players paid for exclusive use of Elfsong Tavern first floor.

Patron_015_11.speaker: Roger Gherkins
Patron_015_11.text: Sure, the Steel Watchers are just so much scrap now, but how come nobody's talking about the collapse of the foundry? That place is prime real estate, mixed use, residential and industrial! How I'd love to get that contract.

Patron_015_12.speaker: Roger Gherkins
Patron_015_12.text: Lorroakan's dead, but who are his heirs and assigns? I've got to find out, because they're going to need a good real estate agent if they want to flip that Ramazith's Tower - and Roger Gherkins is the man for the job!
Patron_015_12.context: InternalNodeContext: Lorroakan has been deposed from Ramazith's Tower + no longer owns Sorcerous Sundries

Patron_015_13.speaker: Roger Gherkins
Patron_015_13.text: Wyrm's Rock penthouse! There must be some way to get a piece of that.
Patron_015_13.context: InternalNodeContext: Coronation of Gortash as lord of Baldur's Gate.

Patron_015_14.speaker: Roger Gherkins
Patron_015_14.text: Say, it's the city's new hero! I hope you're looking to settle down here. If so, Roger Gherkins is your man for real estate! Once the situation stabilises, of course.
Patron_015_14.context: InternalNodeContext: Reputation booster because an article at Baldur's Mouth

Patron_015_15.speaker: Roger Gherkins
Patron_015_15.text: Yeah, let's see, buy a shack in Brampton, flip it and snap up a hovel in Heapside - it's the road to riches, my friend! The road to riches.
Patron_015_15.context: InternalNodeContext: Iron Throne Destruction (ie. vague trouble in harbour)

Patron_015_16.speaker: Roger Gherkins
Patron_015_16.text: Even in Baldur's Gate, I'm telling you, it's all about location.

Patron_015_17.speaker: Roger Gherkins
Patron_015_17.text: Not that I'd ever get the chance to list the Wyrm's Rock penthouse. Still... Wait a minute, I know a guy!

Cat_002_SwA_6.speaker: Zambomba
Cat_002_SwA_6.text: The rats are dead? Your performance is adequate, servant.

Cat_002_SwA_7.speaker: Zambomba
Cat_002_SwA_7.text: Mrah! Look, Tambourine, a servant comes to help us.

Cat_002_SwA_4.speaker: Zambomba
Cat_002_SwA_4.text: Kill those rats, would you? When they're dead, the other servants will feed us.

Cat_002_SwA_8.speaker: Zambomba
Cat_002_SwA_8.text: Back again? We're trying to relax here.

AD_Patron_013_0.speaker: Wrilda Gemfinder
AD_Patron_013_0.text: I hear Alan's rented out the upstairs to some ragged vagabonds. Must be desperate.
AD_Patron_013_0.context: InternalNodeContext: The players paid for exclusive use of Elfsong Tavern first floor.

AD_Patron_013_1.speaker: Wrilda Gemfinder
AD_Patron_013_1.text: City's gotten noisy, eh? Refugees everywhere.
AD_Patron_013_1.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the Absolute

AD_Patron_013_2.speaker: Wrilda Gemfinder
AD_Patron_013_2.text: Why did we need an Archduke? Wasn't a Grand Duke enough?
AD_Patron_013_2.context: InternalNodeContext: Coronation of Gortash as lord of Baldur's Gate.

AD_Patron_013_3.speaker: Wrilda Gemfinder
AD_Patron_013_3.text: What's the name of the new manager at Sorcerous Sundries? Roland? Roldan?
AD_Patron_013_3.context: InternalNodeContext: Rolan as new owner of Sorcerous Sundries

AD_Patron_013_4.speaker: Wrilda Gemfinder
AD_Patron_013_4.text: The Steel Watchers - wrecked! I didn't think I'd miss them, but I do.

ComedyTournament_Watcher002_0.speaker: Waldo Walnut
ComedyTournament_Watcher002_0.text: I am hopeful that we shall be thoroughly entertained. I hear this fellow is monstrously droll.

ComedyTournament_Watcher002_1.speaker: Waldo Walnut
ComedyTournament_Watcher002_1.text: I say, this Willoughby person has a smashing monocle, what?

ComedyTournament_Watcher002_2.speaker: Waldo Walnut
ComedyTournament_Watcher002_2.text: Heh heh. Ahem. Yes, very amusing. Very amusing indeed.

ComedyTournament_Watcher002_3.speaker: Waldo Walnut
ComedyTournament_Watcher002_3.text: Well, that was disappointing. I was led to believe this fellow was humorous.

EmperorAD_RascalCollar_0.text: Rascal's collar... My poor four-legged friend. Their lives are so brief, so simple, and yet - full.

Githyanki_PAD_GithRadarGoingOffComment_0.speaker: Player
Githyanki_PAD_GithRadarGoingOffComment_0.text: The psionic detector's been activated. There must be gith hostiles nearby.

Exterior_Patron_008_0.speaker: Rowan Elkfriend
Exterior_Patron_008_0.text: On days like this I miss the forest. I used to scamper amongst my woodland friends, if you can believe it. Here? Not a squirrel in sight.

Exterior_Patron_008_1.speaker: Rowan Elkfriend
Exterior_Patron_008_1.text: Sorry, stranger, for getting maudlin about the forest before. I'm not at my best.

AD_Devella_Fountainhead_Turn3_0.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
AD_Devella_Fountainhead_Turn3_0.text: Baldur's Gate will be your grave, brigand.

EmperorAD_StelemanePortrait_1.text: She's beautiful, isn't she? I always thought Belynne the most regal of all women.

EmperorAD_StelemanePortrait_3.text: There she is in all her glory - Duke Belynne Stelmane. My old partner.

AD_Patron_008_0.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
AD_Patron_008_0.text: I wonder if this was brewed with my barley?
AD_Patron_008_0.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the Absolute

AD_Devella_Fountainhead_Turn2_0.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
AD_Devella_Fountainhead_Turn2_0.text: On my oath I'll see you dead.

Oloric_14.speaker: Oloric Witmirth
Oloric_14.text: Hello again, travellers! Now that I'm a new man, I feel warm benevolence towards all humanity!

Oloric_24.speaker: Player
Oloric_24.text: A new man? Who were you when you were an old man?

Oloric_30.speaker: Oloric Witmirth
Oloric_30.text: A worried man, a playwright who'd lost the will to write. Now I worry no more! Can't write a word? What does it matter?

Oloric_28.speaker: Player
Oloric_28.text: You sound kind of messed up, to be honest.

Oloric_7.speaker: Oloric Witmirth
Oloric_7.text: Messed up is what I was before! I was a playwright who'd lost the will to create. Now I see just how little that matters.

Oloric_18.speaker: Oloric Witmirth
Oloric_18.text: Hello, old friend! Or so I assume. I used to know everybody around town, but now I'm a new man.

Cook_Assistant_0.speaker: Chef's Assistant Tecochi
Cook_Assistant_0.text: I don't care what Roveer says, a turner and a spatula aren't the same thing. Hmf. Some chef.

Cook_Assistant_1.speaker: Chef's Assistant Tecochi
Cook_Assistant_1.text: Roveer burned the bouillabaisse again, and now I have to scrub the pot. Some chef he is. Hmf!

Exterior_Patron_009_0.speaker: Flo Minsydel
Exterior_Patron_009_0.text: Shove off, soldier. You're not my type.

Exterior_Patron_009_1.speaker: Flo Minsydel
Exterior_Patron_009_1.text: Still here? Hit the bricks, I'm not looking for company.

EmperorAD_AfterKillRats_1.text: You're getting close - the wine cellar. There's a hidden door that leads further in.

EmperorAD_AfterKillRats_0.text: The mechanism to open it is somewhere among the wine racks.

ComedyTournament_Watcher003_0.speaker: Saer Preciosa
ComedyTournament_Watcher003_0.text: I hope this comedian is as good as they say he is. If the Absolute is going to kill us all, I want to go out laughing.

ComedyTournament_Watcher003_1.speaker: Saer Preciosa
ComedyTournament_Watcher003_1.text: Snappy dresser, that Willoughby, though he should lose the monocle.

ComedyTournament_Watcher003_2.speaker: Saer Preciosa
ComedyTournament_Watcher003_2.text: Now that was funny. I needed a good laugh. Grim times, eh, stranger?

ComedyTournament_Watcher003_3.speaker: Saer Preciosa
ComedyTournament_Watcher003_3.text: Dice of Tymora! What an embarrassment. The old Elfsong isn't what it used to be, eh?

AD_Patron_012_0.speaker: 'Ears' Oohna
AD_Patron_012_0.text: Did you hear some scruffy wanderers have rented the whole upper floor?
AD_Patron_012_0.context: InternalNodeContext: The players paid for exclusive use of Elfsong Tavern first floor.

AD_Patron_012_1.speaker: 'Ears' Oohna
AD_Patron_012_1.text: Of course I heard about it. I hear everything.
AD_Patron_012_1.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the Absolute

AD_Patron_012_2.speaker: 'Ears' Oohna
AD_Patron_012_2.context: InternalNodeContext: Coronation of Gortash as lord of Baldur's Gate.

AD_Patron_012_4.speaker: 'Ears' Oohna
AD_Patron_012_4.text: And I heard that Lord Gortash is dead!

AD_Patron_012_5.speaker: 'Ears' Oohna
AD_Patron_012_5.text: They found another murder victim right here in the Elfsong - a duke, no less!
AD_Patron_012_5.context: InternalNodeContext: When Dolor kills Dora and performs the ritual

AD_Patron_012_6.speaker: 'Ears' Oohna
AD_Patron_012_6.text: I'm surprised you'd show your face in public!
AD_Patron_012_6.context: InternalNodeContext: Reputation drop because an article at Baldur's Mouth

AD_Patron_012_7.speaker: 'Ears' Oohna
AD_Patron_012_7.text: And how about that handsome Rolan at Sorcerous Sundries?
AD_Patron_012_7.context: InternalNodeContext: Rolan as new owner of Sorcerous Sundries

AD_Patron_012_8.speaker: 'Ears' Oohna
AD_Patron_012_8.text: You heard that great rumbling sound from the harbour, didn't you?
AD_Patron_012_8.context: InternalNodeContext: Iron Throne Destruction (ie. vague trouble in harbour)

AD_Patron_012_9.speaker: 'Ears' Oohna
AD_Patron_012_9.text: Those noisy Steel Watchers are gone at last!

AD_Patron_012_10.speaker: 'Ears' Oohna
AD_Patron_012_10.text: I always knew Lorroakan wouldn't last.
AD_Patron_012_10.context: InternalNodeContext: Lorroakan has been deposed from Ramazith's Tower + no longer owns Sorcerous Sundries

AD_Patron_012_11.speaker: 'Ears' Oohna
AD_Patron_012_11.text: You're good news for Baldur's Gate, from what I hear.
AD_Patron_012_11.context: InternalNodeContext: Reputation booster because an article at Baldur's Mouth

AD_Patron_012_12.speaker: 'Ears' Oohna
AD_Patron_012_12.text: They got the killer - the murder spree is over!
AD_Patron_012_12.context: InternalNodeContext: When Dolor kills Dora and performs the ritual

Patron_014_0.speaker: Blevindall
Patron_014_0.text: Some folks are upset the Elfsong is out of their signature plum prosecco, but I can't stomach it. Dreadful stuff.
Patron_014_0.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the Absolute

Patron_014_1.speaker: Blevindall
Patron_014_1.text: Alan Alyth finally managed to rent out his whole upper floor, I hear. Maybe now he'll be able to afford to get it renovated. So shabby!
Patron_014_1.context: InternalNodeContext: The players paid for exclusive use of Elfsong Tavern first floor.

Patron_014_2.speaker: Blevindall
Patron_014_2.text: They have lovely dessert drinks here, but I'm giving them a pass. Must stay slim and trim!
Patron_014_2.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the Absolute

Patron_014_3.speaker: Blevindall
Patron_014_3.text: I would love to have seen Gortash's coronation, but I would have to have skipped the after feast - I'm on a strict diet.
Patron_014_3.context: InternalNodeContext: Coronation of Gortash as lord of Baldur's Gate.

Patron_014_4.speaker: Blevindall
Patron_014_4.text: If Lorroakan had been trim from the Waterdeep water diet, I wager things would have gone differently for him.
Patron_014_4.context: InternalNodeContext: Lorroakan has been deposed from Ramazith's Tower + no longer owns Sorcerous Sundries

Patron_014_5.speaker: Blevindall
Patron_014_5.text: The rumour is that Lord Gortash is dead! It couldn't have been his health, he didn't look an ounce overweight.

Patron_014_6.speaker: Blevindall
Patron_014_6.text: I hear Rolan's got a pretty cute little brother, too. I wonder how late the Sundries is open today?
Patron_014_6.context: InternalNodeContext: Rolan as new owner of Sorcerous Sundries

Patron_014_7.speaker: Blevindall
Patron_014_7.text: Just look at you! So tasty!
Patron_014_7.context: InternalNodeContext: Reputation booster because an article at Baldur's Mouth

Patron_014_8.speaker: Blevindall
Patron_014_8.text: I read that young mage Rolan is the new manager of Sorcerous Sundries! I don't usually go for the horned type, but, oh my!
Patron_014_8.context: InternalNodeContext: Rolan as new owner of Sorcerous Sundries

Patron_014_9.speaker: Blevindall
Patron_014_9.text: You must have heard the big explosion from the harbour! I felt it right down in my... you know.
Patron_014_9.context: InternalNodeContext: Iron Throne Destruction (ie. vague trouble in harbour)

Patron_014_10.speaker: Blevindall
Patron_014_10.text: I understand that you're the one who rented out the upstairs! Forget I said anything.
Patron_014_10.context: InternalNodeContext: The players paid for exclusive use of Elfsong Tavern first floor.

Patron_014_11.speaker: Blevindall
Patron_014_11.text: I know some people were afraid of them, but I loved looking at those Steel Watchers marching around the city. So strong and athletic. Made me feel safe.

Patron_014_12.speaker: Blevindall
Patron_014_12.text: I've seen that Lorroakan in here, stuffing his face with pastries! I bet he was just too slow to dodge whatever it was that got him.
Patron_014_12.context: InternalNodeContext: Lorroakan has been deposed from Ramazith's Tower + no longer owns Sorcerous Sundries

Patron_014_13.speaker: Blevindall
Patron_014_13.text: I'm on the Waterdeep water diet, you know: twelve bottles of pure aqua per day!
Patron_014_13.context: InternalNodeContext: Coronation of Gortash as lord of Baldur's Gate.

Patron_014_14.speaker: Blevindall
Patron_014_14.text: I'm not surprised anyone as trim and fit as you has such a good reputation. Yum!
Patron_014_14.context: InternalNodeContext: Reputation booster because an article at Baldur's Mouth

Patron_014_15.speaker: Blevindall
Patron_014_15.text: I hope whatever happened in the harbour will clear out those nasty sahuagin! I want to show off my cute new bathing wear.
Patron_014_15.context: InternalNodeContext: Iron Throne Destruction (ie. vague trouble in harbour)

Patron_014_16.speaker: Blevindall
Patron_014_16.text: With the Steel Watchers gone, who will protect us from the bugbears and goblins?

Patron_014_17.speaker: Blevindall
Patron_014_17.text: I guess if death can come for Gortash, it can come for any of us, eh?

Exterior_Patron_005_0.speaker: Phoebelia
Exterior_Patron_005_0.text: Vinshent, here, is a wastrel and a scapegrace. But he does amuse me.

Exterior_Patron_005_1.speaker: Phoebelia
Exterior_Patron_005_1.text: Well. If you left, you must be back again. My, but how I amuse myself!

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_207.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_207.text: I know a lot about Bhaal. I suspect he's involved with this.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_276.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_276.text: I know a lot about Bhaal. I suspect he's involved with this.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_108.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_108.text: I found another murder victim. Absolute symbol nearby, just like Stelmane.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_180.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_180.text: Another? Whoever's behind this is certainly effective, and I've no more Fists to spare. Tell me you've found something else that could actually help us?

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_161.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_161.text: I found this bottle of wine - it's poisonous.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_121.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_121.text: Hmm. That tracks. The killer paralyses the victim with poison. And wine is a perfectly innocuous vessel for it.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_115.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_115.text: But that doesn't get us any closer to motive.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_242.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_242.text: Nor does it tie this back to the Bhaalist resurgence.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_170.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_170.text: Remind me what I'm looking for?

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_194.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_194.text: Something, anything that can link these murders to the Bhaalist resurgence.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_200.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_200.text: The key to solving a murder is to understand the motive. The ritualistic nature of these killings point to the Absolute, but I don't buy it. It's too convenient.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_148.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_148.text: I'll see what else I can find here, but keep your eye out in the city. There'll be more corpses soon, if we can't figure this out.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_123.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_123.text: Get back to it, then. Lives depend on it. Literally.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_135.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_135.text: What? I've got a duke's murder to solve, and not a lot of time to do it.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_164.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_164.text: Oh bollocks - I told those idiots not to let anyone through.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_117.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_117.text: YOU. Name, rank, and reason for interrupting an active crime scene. For your sake, the last one better be bloody good.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_35.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_35.text: Are you Devella? Valeria sent me.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_233.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_233.text: To fetch her another bottle of mead, no doubt.
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_233.context: NodeContext: muttered darkly under her breath

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_173.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_173.text: Yes, I'm Devella, the unfortunate colleague.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_289.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_289.text: Unless you've got useful information, leave me to my work. Duke Stelmane's dead - and I've got to find who killed her.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_56.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_56.text: I know more about Bhaal than anyone you'll find. You don't want to send me away.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_258.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_258.text: Valeria said you might want to see this. Show her the murder target list.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_251.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_251.text: Useful information like this? Show her the murder target list.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_232.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_232.text: Tell her about the murder target list you found.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_91.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_91.text: Gods - that's it! Proof that I was right.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_211.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_211.text: Was it an aspiring Bhaal cultist by any chance?

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_124.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_124.text: There's more at stake than Stelmane's murder now that Bhaal himself is involved.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_62.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_62.text: Bhaal? That's exactly what I - wait. How do you know about that?
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_62.context: NodeContext: with the realisation that her improbable conclusion/investigation was bang on the money but also still suspicious of the player (how do THEY know?!)

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_256.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_256.text: Don't panic, but I'm sort of... his spawn.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_219.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_219.text: Oh! Oh my. By Ilmater's rack, that's... that's...

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_281.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_281.text: I should arrest you at once, but - well, the Bhaalspawn crisis, it's the most interesting criminal plight in Baldurian history.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_102.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_102.text: If what you claim is true, you wouldn't be helping me here unless you were trying to end Bhaal's hold over you.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_268.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_268.text: Just like the wayward Bhaalspawn who saved the Gate before...

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_255.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_255.text: You are here to help me, and not to sacrifice me, aren't you?

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_15.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_15.text: You're very excited about Bhaal for someone who's supposed to be protecting the city.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_144.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_144.text: It's my job to be. Though I confess it has been very interesting.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_153.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_153.text: You see, these murders have been cropping up all over the city. I've been following their trail for a while now, and tracing it back to its roots.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_84.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_84.text: The ritualistic brutality of them... it's extraordinary. And it could only be the work of a Bhaalist.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_2.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_2.text: But you've been investigating too, if I'm not mistaken? You're trying to stop your own kind?

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_9.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_9.text: I am working against Bhaal - I got a hold of the list of murder targets.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_253.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_253.text: I'm working against Bhaal - I found the murderer's target list.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_89.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_89.text: Tell her of the target list. Say nothing of your intentions.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_139.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_139.text: Show her the target list. Say nothing of your intentions.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_284.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_284.text: I'm glad you're on the right side of this, Bhaalspawn. You could be invaluable, if you can get on the inside.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_225.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_225.text: Hells, you might be the only one who can stop this. What else do you know?

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_247.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_247.text: I was hoping you could tell me more.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_59.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_59.text: Most of what I know is based on reading into Sarevok's history. I'm sure it's nothing next to your personal experience, but I'll share what I have.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_140.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_140.text: A century ago, Bhaal bred dozens just like you. One of whom was Sarevok Anchev.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_285.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_285.text: I'm planning to infiltrate the cult, but I don't know where to start.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_4.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_4.text: Bhaal is trying to force me to be his Chosen. I'm doing all I can to resist him.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_271.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_271.text: So it's all happening again... just like in Sarevok's time...

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_277.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_277.text: Father has shown me visions - the Temple of Bhaal lurks somewhere in the city.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_239.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_239.text: I don't know much. I only just found out I was a Bhaalspawn in a vision.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_51.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_51.text: You've had a busy tenday. I can't even imagine. Well, I'll tell you what I know.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_182.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_182.text: I am here to sacrifice you, I'm afraid.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_21.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_21.text: Ah, hells. I will live to warn the Gate. FISTS!

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_261.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_261.text: Recount your investigation into Father Lorgan's murder, and what you remember of the list you found.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_113.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_113.text: Tell her about the murder target list you found.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_50.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_50.text: Show her the list of murder targets.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_203.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_203.text: Recount your investigation into Father Lorgan's murder, and show her the list you found.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_25.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_25.text: Tell her about the murder target list you found while investigating Lorgan's murder.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_220.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_220.text: Never mind me - how do you know about Bhaal's resurgence?

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_105.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_105.text: It's becoming something of an obsession of mine. You see, these murders have been cropping up all over the city.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_221.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_221.text: They're always the same - victim paralysed by poison, Absolutist symbol scrawled on the floor in blood. Hand removed pre-mortem.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_252.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_252.text: And the removal of the hand pre-mortem... the unnecessary brutality of it - it's got to be connected to Bhaal, it's just got to be.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_6.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_6.text: Now your turn. What do you know about this?

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_226.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_226.text: I was just fearmongering for fun. Bhaal's not back. Everything is fine.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_20.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_20.text: You're a terrible liar. You've got something. Give it here.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_236.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_236.text: Gods... This is it. The proof that I was right!
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_236.context: CinematicNodeContext: Devella takes and studies the list

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_96.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_96.text: I've been working on an assignment, see - a research project of sorts. I knew my conclusions were sound, but this... I never expected this.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_210.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_210.text: I'll tell you what I know.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_167.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_167.text: A century ago, there was a man - Sarevok Anchev. He was a child of the god of murder, Bhaal.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_243.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_243.text: He ruled the Iron Throne - a dark tower hiding a darker secret. It was the front for a deadly arms-dealing network.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_71.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_71.text: There, Sarevok amassed an army and sought to become a god. Under his stewardship, the Bhaal Temple was revived, and with it, the Bhaal cult itself.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_0.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_0.text: Fortunately, the Temple was destroyed, and to cleanse the city of Sarevok's memory, the Iron Throne was torn from its foundations and cast into the Chionthar.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_31.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_31.text: For most, that was the end of it. But cults like that don't disappear overnight. This list you brought me confirms I'm right.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_119.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_119.text: The Bhaal cult is back, and someone is out there, continuing Sarevok's work.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_185.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_185.text: Bhaal has a new Chosen in Baldur's Gate - Orin. I suspect she's behind this.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_82.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_82.text: What makes you think it's not Sarevok himself?

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_28.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_28.text: I've not ruled out the possibility that it is Sarevok himself.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_201.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_201.text: The brutality of the killings is certainly reminiscent of his work. But there's something more here, something new...

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_216.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_216.text: There's a reverence to these murders, a certain flair. It's as if they were done in worship.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_130.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_130.text: The precision of the cuts, the depth, the execution - the best butchers in Faerûn couldn't make a cut like that. Trust me, I've asked them.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_107.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_107.text: I tried to explain all this to my superiors, but they wouldn't have any of it.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_126.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_126.text: They told me to drop it. Told me the city doesn't need another conspiracy theorist and to get back to doing my job before they find someone else to do it for me.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_159.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_159.text: But you - you're not bound by such constraints. Help me out, here. Help the city out.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_213.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_213.text: Follow the trail of these murders. Prove the truth. Use your lineage to get places the Fist can't.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_111.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_111.text: I'll bet if you follow the trail of these murders, you'll be able to unearth the truth of this resurgence.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_181.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_181.text: Believe me, I wish I could. But I need this job.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_197.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_197.text: Half the silkroot-chewers in the Gate have claimed to be a Bhaalspawn at one point. The Fist don't listen to ghost stories.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_188.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_188.text: You're better off not raising any suspicions. Trust me.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_208.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_208.text: What will you do in the meantime?

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_1.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_1.text: What about the other victims on the list, the ones who are still alive?

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_46.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_46.text: I'm going to stop my Father, whatever it takes.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_199.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_199.text: If anyone can, it will be you. Or at least that's what the legends say.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_254.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_254.text: But before you run off, do you think you could save a few more lives?

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_217.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_217.text: You really are a godsend. But - one more thing...

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_3.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_3.text: I'm trying to hide from my Father's wrath. I fear what will happen if I delve too deeply.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_110.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_110.text: Then I hope you can at least protect yourself, and pray this plot fails.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_137.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_137.text: But before you run and hide, there are a few more lives you could easily save.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_157.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_157.text: I've got better things to do than investigate a cult.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_17.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_17.text: I suppose it was quite an ask... but perhaps you wouldn't mind doing me a different, smaller favour?

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_120.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_120.text: There are patriars on the murder target list. I'm oathbound to secure them first, so I'll be heading to the Upper City next.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_37.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_37.text: While I'm there, the other potential victims will be at risk. Could you warn them?

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_195.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_195.text: The Flaming Fist should be protecting everyone - not just Upper City folk.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_109.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_109.text: Not from around here, are you? We're in Baldur's Gate - this is just how things work.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_212.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_212.text: I'll see what I can do.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_283.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_283.text: Thank you. That's all I can ask, and more than I hoped.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_163.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_163.text: Isn't it enough that I already agreed to investigate the murder trail?

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_234.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_234.text: You seemed capable - it would have been remiss of me not to ask. But I understand.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_162.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_162.text: Once I'm done with the patriars, I'll head to Basilisk Gate to have another go at convincing my superiors to put some resources into this matter.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_230.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_230.text: Meet me there if you've anything more to report. And good luck.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_66.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_66.text: That's your job. Not my problem if you only want to help the rich.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_57.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_57.text: You don't seem to understand - my job is to help the rich first.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_274.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_274.text: But fine, if you're not interested in helping, I guess I'll just have to try and convince my superiors to put some resources into this matter.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_99.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_99.text: Once I've secured the patriars, I'll head to Basilisk Gate. Meet me there if you have a change of heart.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_100.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_100.text: The people of the Gate are fortunate another of Bhaal's children stands against him. Walk in light.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_248.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_248.text: I've done everything I can within the remit of my job. Any more, and they'll fire me.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_229.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_229.text: I think it may be a Bhaalspawn...

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_192.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_192.text: I think it may be another Bhaalspawn...

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_178.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_178.text: Gods save us all if you're right, but I'd believe it. Whoever it is, they are intimately familiar with Sarevok's work.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_152.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_152.text: No idea, unfortunately. But whoever it is, they are intimately familiar with Sarevok's work.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_13.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_13.text: You said Sarevok led the cultists a century ago - he can't still be alive, can he?

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_151.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_151.text: Stranger things have come back to haunt this city.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_11.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_11.text: You're absolutely right. I have reasons of my own to think there's been an increase in Bhaalist activity.
