PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_47.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_47.text: Good. Then your eyes are open to the truth.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_290.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_290.text: The brutality of the killings is on a par with Sarevok's own. But there's something more here, something new...

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_147.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_147.text: You're not wrong about the cult. I found some Bhaalists in the sewers.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_98.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_98.text: No doubt you found a trail of bodies in their wake?

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_196.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_196.text: Not only is the cult back, it's spreading fast. I ran into some Bhaalists in the park.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_54.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_54.text: You should raise this with your superiors, immediately.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_241.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_241.text: Don't you think I've tried? They won't listen.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_127.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_127.text: You're lucky you met me - most of the Fist wouldn't have believed you were a Bhaalspawn. Think it's Baldurian superstition.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_72.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_72.text: For most, that was the end of it. But cults like that don't disappear overnight. That list you spoke of confirms I'm right.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_155.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_155.text: You're a terrible liar. Tell me everything - now.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_70.speaker: Narrator
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_70.text: *Begrudgingly, you tell her about the murder target list you found.*

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_136.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_136.text: Ah, another sceptic. You should consider joining the Fist. You'll find plenty of like-minded folks.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_177.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_177.text: Now if you don't mind, I've work to do.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_145.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_145.text: It's simple really. I kill you, as an offering to Bhaal.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_27.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_27.text: Because I am going to kill you now - in his unholy name.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_94.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_94.text: Let me help you - I trained under Camber Fosrick, the world's greatest investigative mind.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_222.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_222.text: Nice try. That name's straight out of those dreadful Cormyr detective stories. Get lost - I've work to do.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_58.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_58.text: Do you need some help? I've dealt with much worse than this.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_77.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_77.text: Suppose it couldn't hurt - we're scraping the barrel as is right now.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_67.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_67.text: Look, kid. I can see you mean well. But I'm not letting a civilian get involved.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_146.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_146.text: Use the crime scene to describe how Stelmane was killed. Show her you can help solve this.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_55.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_55.text: Very nice. Correct on most counts - you might prove useful.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_75.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_75.text: Here's all I've found. The duke was paralysed by poison, Absolutist symbol scrawled on the floor in blood. Hand removed pre-mortem.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_69.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_69.text: The symbol's the bit that bothers most. You use poison when you want to get away with murder. So why leave a symbol at the scene of the crime? It doesn't make any sense.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_65.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_65.text: And the removal of the hand... I've a theory, but - well, you're a civilian. That one will be for me to follow up.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_112.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_112.text: Oh, you saw? I suppose there's no harm in sharing it with you. It's just a theory, after all...

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_43.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_43.text: I've been working on an assignment - a side-project of sorts. I think the removal of the hand is the key, but I just can't figure out how.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_41.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_41.text: Corpses without hands are showing up all over the city. Together with dioramas of death and murder. It has to be connected.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_215.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_215.text: The brutality of it, the unnecessary brutality... My theory is that it's got something to do with the Lord of Murder himself - Bhaal.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_53.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_53.text: The higher-ups don't want to hear that, of course. The last thing they need is public hysteria about a cult that was supposed to have died out over a century ago.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_125.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_125.text: I'd follow up myself, but while this uniform gets me into certain places, it keeps me out of others. Especially places that don't want to be found...

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_73.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_73.text: I need to look into the Bhaalists, and fast. I think they're after me.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_141.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_141.text: Perfect. Unofficially, mind. As far as the higher-ups are concerned, you're still just a civilian. If you end up breaking any laws, well - I won't be able to help you.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_12.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_12.text: Report back to me if you find anything. And thank you. If I'm right, you'll be doing a great service to the city.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_158.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_158.text: I understand. I'll look into this Bhaalist resurgence for you.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_44.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_44.text: Take the uniform off, then. Go undercover.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_86.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_86.text: Oh believe me, I wish I could. But that's above my paygrade. Besides, someone's got to oversee the investigation here.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_142.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_142.text: I can't help you. I've got business of my own.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_183.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_183.text: Everyone does in this city. All right, but keep your eyes peeled, and your mouth shut. If you find anything, tell me, but best not to go alarming the other Fists.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_272.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_272.text: Lucky you! The future Chosen of Bhaal stands before you, and you will be their offering!

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_154.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_154.text: Tell me your theory. Perhaps I can help.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_34.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_34.text: It's nice of you to indulge me, but I'm afraid this matter is a little too sensitive to share as a mere indulgence.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_263.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_263.text: Thank you for your interest, citizen, but I'd best get back to doing the real work. Alone.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_206.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_206.text: Try to read her body language.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_26.speaker: Narrator
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_26.text: *She's not just reticent to share her theory - she's hiding a physical object. A document of some sort.*

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_118.speaker: Narrator
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_118.text: *She's tense, that much is clear to see. But her professional veneer is simply too resistant to amateur probing.*

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_214.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_214.text: Look, I'd love to stand around and chat, but there's work to be done.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_260.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_260.text: If you find something, let me know. But don't get your hopes up. I certainly won't.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_74.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_74.text: I'll see what I can find.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_138.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_138.text: Don't get your hopes up, but do report back if you find something. The people of Baldur's Gate will be grateful for a breakthrough in this case.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_49.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_49.text: I'll leave you to your work.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_189.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_189.text: I've seen my share of dead bodies. Maybe I can be of help?

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_238.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_238.text: I have seen death and cruelty in all its forms. Perhaps I could be of service?

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_24.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_24.text: I am no stranger to hunting down vicious killers - be they man or beast. Perhaps I could help?

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_246.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_246.text: Of course. You're a civilian. You shouldn't be involved in this.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_223.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_223.text: An adventurer. Fantastic. We don't have enough of those in Baldur's Gate.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_87.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_87.text: Uh, [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53], recently unemployed, I quite like murders?

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_83.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_83.text: Erm. [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53], amnesiac, I care about preventing murders?

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_156.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_156.text: A hobbyist detective? I can't fault the drive - I read the Baldur's Mouth crime reports like a starving wereboar before I worked for the Fist.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_265.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_265.text: But you should leave it to the professionals. It's not healthy for civilians to see scenes of such a sensitive nature.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_227.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_227.text: I'm no one - just another adventurer.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_270.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_270.text: I'm chasing down a serial killer who seems to kill without motive. You try doing that and staying calm.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_143.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_143.text: You're doing a grand job. I hope the person who solves your murder will be just as diligent.
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_143.context: NodeContext: she realises the player is threatening to kill her

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_171.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_171.text: I'm lost. I'll leave you alone.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_286.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_286.text: I thought I made myself very clear, civilian. Move along.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_134.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_134.text: I know a lot about Bhaal. I suspect he's involved with this.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_249.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_249.text: I know a lot about Bhaal. I suspect he's involved with this.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_235.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_235.text: You're going to want to see this. Show her the murder target list.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_176.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_176.text: Tell her about the target list.

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_90.speaker: Player
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_90.text: Are you sure I can't help?

PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_92.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PrivateRoom_Devella_Fountainhead_92.text: Sure as the stench of an ogre's latrine. Get lost.

EmperorAD_CellarDoor_0.text: Good. On the other side, you'll find a passageway known only to those invited to do business.

Patron006_0.speaker: Bombasto
Patron006_0.text: Of course, if I was one of the Fists, I'd make sure things got straightened out in these streets double-quick.
Patron006_0.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the Absolute

Patron006_1.speaker: Bombasto
Patron006_1.text: I sure wouldn't want to be one of the Flaming Fists - they've got the shittiest job in town. Believe me, I know something about knocking heads together.
Patron006_1.context: InternalNodeContext: The base topic of this character. You can choose between: Murders at temple, Steel Watch, Brain-Quakes, Impending coronation of Gortash, Gang war: Guild vs. Stone Men, Approaching Army of the Absolute

FlamingFist_001_0.speaker: Fist Rusk
FlamingFist_001_0.text: Beat it, I said. No more warnings.

FlamingFist_001_1.speaker: Fist Rusk
FlamingFist_001_1.text: Move quickly and I'll let you go, stranger. We've had enough trouble for one day.

Githyanki_AD_Caster_0.speaker: Veteran Gish Zhendila
Githyanki_AD_Caster_0.text: We've exhausted all reinforcements - we are the final stand. Ch'mar, zal'a Vlaakith!

EmperorAD_SoupRecipe_0.text: A recipe for fiddlehead soup - a favourite meal of mine, when I had need of meals like that.

EmperorAD_EmperorSeeGithyanki_0.text: Githyanki... Vlaakith has found us. Get rid of them. Quickly!

EmperorAD_EmperorSeeGithyanki_1.text: Githyanki? What are they doing here...? Get rid of them.

PAD_KarabasansGift_0.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PAD_KarabasansGift_0.text: The amateur investigator schtick is cute, but unneeded. We knew that already.

PAD_KarabasansGift_1.speaker: Gauntlet Devella Fountainhead
PAD_KarabasansGift_1.text: Quite right - nasty paralytic agent. Explains the lack of struggle.

Lakrissa_1.speaker: Lakrissa
Lakrissa_1.text: What can I get you? Make it as easy as possible and leave a big tip - thanks.

Lakrissa_31.speaker: Lakrissa
Lakrissa_31.text: Well, well, look what the bugbear dragged in.
Lakrissa_31.context: NodeContext: flirty, delighted to be reuinited with the player (haven't seen each other since moonrise)

Lakrissa_25.speaker: Lakrissa
Lakrissa_25.text: Can't believe we both made it to the city - and with our limbs attached.

Lakrissa_17.speaker: Player
Lakrissa_17.text: Didn't we make a bet in the druids' grove? You didn't think you'd survive, yet here you are.

Lakrissa_26.speaker: Lakrissa
Lakrissa_26.text: We did, didn't we? Never thought I'd begrudge being alive.
Lakrissa_26.context: NodeContext: teasing, acting a little grumpy

Lakrissa_39.speaker: Lakrissa
Lakrissa_39.text: Alas, I've got nothing in my pockets but lint and disappointment.

Lakrissa_23.speaker: Player
Lakrissa_23.text: You owe me nothing - don't worry about it.

Lakrissa_21.speaker: Lakrissa
Lakrissa_21.text: How are you both humble and attractive? It's just not fair, nor will my honour allow it.

Lakrissa_7.speaker: Lakrissa
Lakrissa_7.text: Back in the grove I'd have taken you up on that - but my situation has changed, somewhat.
Lakrissa_7.context: NodeContext: an unusually shy smile from lakrissa (she's thinking about alfira), but she's being coy about it

Lakrissa_30.speaker: Lakrissa
Lakrissa_30.text: Alas - I am in the middle of a shift. And I can't afford to get fired just yet.

Lakrissa_11.speaker: Player
Lakrissa_11.text: You still have to pay up.

Lakrissa_0.speaker: Lakrissa
Lakrissa_0.text: If I could summon coppers with my mind, I wouldn't be working in a tavern, now would I?

Lakrissa_46.speaker: Lakrissa
Lakrissa_46.text: So how about this: Alan puts swill in the bottles, but I know where he keeps the good stuff. Here - you saw nothing. You heard nothing.
Lakrissa_46.context: NodeContext: idea has just dawned on her. Happy because she gets to screw her cheap boss of a bit AND repay a debt. Hands over a key

Lakrissa_6.speaker: Lakrissa
Lakrissa_6.text: I need to get back to work before Alan throws a fit, but stick around - you brighten the place up.

Lakrissa_43.speaker: Player
Lakrissa_43.text: Perhaps I can help with that. I'd like to trade.

Lakrissa_38.speaker: Lakrissa
Lakrissa_38.text: Working, what else? Alan's short on coppers - the Counting House is screwing him over.

Lakrissa_18.speaker: Player
Lakrissa_18.text: Never pictured you as a barmaid.

Lakrissa_10.speaker: Lakrissa
Lakrissa_10.text: Well, I'd pick this over Moonrise - as delightful as that was. Alan is short on coppers - the Counting House is screwing him over.
Lakrissa_10.context: NodeContext: making a joke about moonrise (she was held prisoner then).

Lakrissa_4.speaker: Lakrissa
Lakrissa_4.text: He was willing to hire anyone who'd work for cheap. And I am nothing if not cheap.
Lakrissa_4.context: NodeContext: making fun of herself, very light tone, she doesn't actually believe this

Lakrissa_20.speaker: Player
Lakrissa_20.text: Never call yourself cheap, Lakrissa. You are priceless.

Lakrissa_41.speaker: Lakrissa
Lakrissa_41.text: Oh, you are smooth, hero - I knew there was a reason I missed you.

Lakrissa_16.speaker: Lakrissa
Lakrissa_16.text: I need to get back to work, but stick around - you brighten the place up.

Lakrissa_2.speaker: Player
Lakrissa_2.text: I missed you. It's good to see you.

Lakrissa_34.speaker: Lakrissa
Lakrissa_34.text: You too, good-looking. Now get out of here - can't be acting all soppy in front of the customers.

Lakrissa_29.speaker: Lakrissa
Lakrissa_29.text: I see you've been taking management lessons from Alan.

Lakrissa_3.speaker: Lakrissa
Lakrissa_3.text: But fine - I do need to eat, I suppose. But stick around - you brighten the place up.
Lakrissa_3.context: NodeContext: little flirty at the end

Lakrissa_22.speaker: Player
Lakrissa_22.text: Where's Alfira? The two of you are usually together, no?

Lakrissa_35.speaker: Lakrissa
Lakrissa_35.text: Ahem - check the roof. But you didn't hear that from me.
Lakrissa_35.context: NodeContext: sly wink and a smile (alfira is upstairs performing)

Lakrissa_45.speaker: Player
Lakrissa_45.text: Let's hope that extends to your prices. I'd like to trade.

Lakrissa_33.speaker: Player
Lakrissa_33.text: Busy stealing from the Elfsong, are you?

Lakrissa_19.speaker: Lakrissa
Lakrissa_19.text: If so, I picked the wrong place to rob. Alan's short on coppers - the Counting House is screwing him over.
Lakrissa_19.context: NodeContext: player is kinda being a dick to her and she just fobs it off with her usual charm

Lakrissa_13.speaker: Lakrissa
Lakrissa_13.text: But he was willing to hire anyone who'd work for cheap. And I am nothing if not cheap.
Lakrissa_13.context: NodeContext: making fun of herself, very light tone, she doesn't actually believe this

Lakrissa_27.speaker: Player
Lakrissa_27.text: Cost me a fair amount of supplies, too. Got anything to trade?

Falten_9.speaker: Player
Falten_9.text: How would I know where your mop is?

Falten_5.speaker: Waiter Falten
Falten_5.text: It  was a rhetorical question. Do you know what that means? No, of course not. Who would know anything about rhetoric in this place?

Falten_3.speaker: Player
Falten_3.text: You don't talk like tavern staff.

Falten_10.speaker: Waiter Falten
Falten_10.text: You are obviously wrong, as demonstrated by the fact that I am on staff at this tavern, and this is my form of elocution.

Falten_13.speaker: Waiter Falten
Falten_13.text: Now, I believe you're standing between me and my mop. Good day.

Falten_11.speaker: Player
Falten_11.text: I might. Get me a drink, we could talk about it.

Falten_12.speaker: Waiter Falten
Falten_12.text: I don't get drinks, I mop. Talk to Alan at the bar.

Falten_8.speaker: Waiter Falten
Falten_8.text: Yes, friend, the sixth one today. You want to be my friend? Do not regurgitate on my floor.

Falten_6.speaker: Waiter Falten
Falten_6.text: Very well, then: no regurgitation. That's a solemn vow, and I'm going to hold you to it.

Falten_1.speaker: Waiter Falten
Falten_1.text: Mop, mop, mop. For this I got a degree in Classics?
